src: Schneider testified via videolink from a USAF base in his homeland.
tgt: Schneider yatanze ubuhamya binyuze muri videwo yafatiwe ku kigo cya USAF kiri mu gihugu cye.

src: Beyond Wednesday's event, Carpanedo competed in two individual races at the Championships.
tgt: Uretse irushanwa ryo ku wa Gatatu, Carpanedo yitabiriye amarushanwa abiri y'abantu ku giti cyabo muri iri rushanwa.

src: Her first was the Slalom, where she earned a Did Not Finish in her first run. 36 of the 116 competitors had the same result in that race.
tgt: Icya mbere yakoze ni irushanwa rya Slalom, aho yatsindiye igihembo cya Did Not Finish mu irushanwa rye rya mbere. 36 mu bakinyi 116 bari mu irushanwa rya Slalom na bo batsindiye igihembo nk'icyo.

src: Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher Gyöngyi Dani of Hungary.
tgt: Mu rundi rukino rwe rwa Giant Slalom, yageze ku mwanya wa cumi mu itsinda ry'abagore bari bicaye mu gihe cya 4:41.30, iminota 2:11.60 irenze uwaje ku mwanya wa mbere w'Umunya-Autriche Claudia Loesch na 1:09.02 irenze uwaje ku mwanya wa cyenda Gyöngyi Dani w'Umunya-Hungary.

src: Four skiers in the women's sitting group failed to finish their runs, and 45 of the 117 total skiers in the Giant Slalom failed to rank in the race.
tgt: Abakinnyi bane bo mu itsinda ry'abakobwa bari bahagaze, ntibashoboye gusoza irushanwa, kandi abakinnyi 45 bo mu itsinda rya Giant Slalom bose hamwe bari 117, ntibashoboye kugera mu cyiciro cya mbere.

src: The Madhya Pradesh Police recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone.
tgt: Igipolisi cya Madhya Pradesh cyabonye laptop n'imashini z'ikoranabuhanga byari byibwe.

src: Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said, "We have arrested five persons who raped the Swiss woman and recovered her mobile and laptop."
tgt: Umuvugizi w'umuvugizi mukuru D K Arya yagize ati "Twafashe abantu batanu bafashe ku ngufu uwo mugore wo mu Busuwisi kandi twarabonye telefoni ye na laptop".

src: The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar.
tgt: Abashinjwa bitwa Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar na Vishnu Kanjar .

src: Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces.
tgt: Umuyobozi w'igipolisi Chandra Shekhar Solanki yavuze ko abashinjwa bagaragaye mu rukiko bafite ibipfukamunwa mu maso.

src: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt.
tgt: N'ubwo hari abantu batatu bari muri iyo nzu igihe iyo modoka yagenderaga kuri yo, nta n'umwe muri bo wakomeretse.

src: However, the driver sustained serious injuries to the head.
tgt: Icyakora, uwo mushoferi yakomeretse bikomeye mu mutwe.

src: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT.
tgt: Inzira aho iki cyaha cyabereye yafunzwe igihe gito mu gihe abakozi b'ibigo by'ubutabazi barekuye umushoferi w'iyo Audi TT yera.

src: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
tgt: Mu mizo ya mbere yajyanywe mu bitaro bya James Paget Hospital i Great Yarmouth.

src: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
tgt: Nyuma yaje kujyanwa mu Bitaro bya Addenbrooke byo muri Cambridge.

src: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.
tgt: Kuva icyo gihe, Adekoya yari mu rukiko rwa Edinburgh Sheriff ashinjwa kwica umuhungu we .

src: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.
tgt: Ubu afungiye muri gereza ategereje ko bamushinja kandi bakamucira urubanza, ariko ibimenyetso by'umuntu wababyiboneye bishobora kubogama kubera ko ifoto ye yanditswe hose.

src: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
tgt: Ibyo ni ibintu bisanzwe mu bindi bice by'u Bwongereza ariko ubutabera bw'u Bwongereza bukora mu buryo butandukanye kandi inkiko zabonye ko gushyira hanze amafoto bishobora guteza imvururu.

src: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
tgt: Profeseri Pamela Ferguson wo muri Kaminuza y'i Dundee avuga ko "abamenyeshamakuru baboneka ko bakora ibintu biteye akaga mu gihe batanga amafoto y'abantu bakekwaho ibyaha n'ibindi".

src: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
tgt: Ibiro by'umwami, bigenzura ibikorwa byose by'iburanisha, byatangaje abanyamakuru ko nta yindi myanzuro izatangazwa, nibura kugeza igihe urubanza ruzatangira.

src: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
tgt: Iyo nyandiko, nk'uko byatangajwe, izerekeza ku rujijo rw'urubibe, Palestina ikaba ishaka ko rwashingira ku rubibe rwariho mbere y'intambara yo mu 1967 yo mu Burasirazuba bwo Hagati.

src: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
tgt: Hari amakuru avuga ko hari n'ibindi bibazo byagarutsweho birimo uko Yerusalemu izaba imeze mu gihe kizaza kuko ari ahantu hatagatifu ku bihugu byombi hamwe n'ikibazo cyo mu Kibaya cya Yorodani.

src: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
tgt: Israel isaba ko abasirikare bayo bakomeza kuba muri uwo mugezi mu gihe cy'imyaka icumi nyuma yo gushyira umukono ku masezerano, mu gihe AP yemera ko izakomeza kuba muri ako gace mu gihe cy'imyaka itanu gusa.

src: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
tgt: Abatoza bari mu igerageza ry'inyongera ryo kurwanya ibicurane bagombaga kugenzurwa cyane n'abarinzi, kuko igerageza ryagenzwaga kandi ingaruka zaryo zikaba zaragenzurwa.

src: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
tgt: Mu bufatanye bwa NPWS na Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, abitanga ku bushake b'abishoboye bashyizwe ku rutonde, mu rwego rw'igikorwa cyo kuroba cya Sporting Shooters Association .

src: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
tgt: Nk'uko Mick O'Flynn, Umuyobozi ushinzwe kurinda ibidukikije n'amateka muri NPWS abivuga, abacukuzi bane batoranyijwe mu gikorwa cya mbere cyo gucukuza, bahawe amabwiriza y'umutekano n'imyitozo yose.

src: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
tgt: Martelly yarahiriye inama nshya y'amatora y'igihe gito (CEP) igizwe n'abantu icyenda ejo.

src: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
tgt: Ni CEP ya gatanu ya Martelly mu myaka ine.

src: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
tgt: Mu kwezi gushize, komisiyo y'umukuru w'igihugu yasabye ko Perezida wa mbere wa CEP ashyira umukono ku masezerano yo gushyira igihugu mu nzira y'amatora mashya.

src: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
tgt: Komisiyo yari igisubizo cya Martelly ku myigaragambyo y'abatavuga rumwe n'ubutegetsi yatangiye mu kwezi kwa cumi.

src: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
tgt: Imyigaragambyo, rimwe na rimwe iba irangwa n'urugomo, yatewe n'uko amatora atagombaga kuba, amwe muri yo akaba yari ateganyijwe guhera mu 2011.

src: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
tgt: Ibibazo bigera kuri 60 by'ibura ry'ibikoresho bya iPod byatewe n'ubushyuhe bukabije, bikaba byateje inkongi z'umuriro zigera kuri esheshatu kandi bigatuma abantu bane bakomerekaho.

src: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
tgt: Minisiteri y'ubukungu, ubucuruzi n'ubucuruzi (METI) yo mu Buyapani yavuze ko yari izi ko habaye impanuka 27 zifitanye isano n'ibyo bikoresho.

src: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
tgt: Mu cyumweru gishize, METI yatangaje ko Apple yamenyesheje izindi ngorane 34 z'ubushyuhe burenze urugero, iyo sosiyete ikaba yarazivuze ko "zitari zikomeye".

src: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
tgt: Minisiteri yasubije ivuga ko gutinda kwa Apple gutanga raporo ari "ikintu cy'agahinda".

src: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
tgt: Iyo nyamugigima yakubise Mariana saa 07:19 z'ijoro (09:19 z'umugoroba ku wa Gatanu).

src: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
tgt: Ibiro by'ishami rishinzwe gukurikirana ibikorwa by'urugomo muri Marianas yo mu Burasirazuba byatangaje ko nta byago byatangajwe mu gihugu.

src: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
tgt: Nanone kandi, Ikigo cy'Akarere ka Pasifika gishinzwe gutanga umuburo ku birebana n'iyo tsunami, cyavuze ko nta kimenyetso cy'iyo tsunami cyari gihari.

src: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
tgt: Uwahoze ari umupolisi wo muri Filipine yafashe ingendo z'abashyitsi bo muri Hong Kong mu buryo butemewe n'amategeko, abinjiza mu modoka yabo mu mujyi wa Manila, umurwa mukuru wa Filipine.

src: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
tgt: Rolando Mendoza yarashe abo baturage n'umutwe w'igitwaro cye cya M16.

src: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
tgt: Abashyizwe mu kato batari bake barakijijwe kandi nibura batandatu bamaze kumenyekana ko bapfuye kugeza ubu.

src: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
tgt: Abantu batandatu bari bafashwe, harimo abana n'abageze mu za bukuru, barekuwe hakiri kare, kimwe n'abafataga amafoto bo muri Filipine.

src: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
tgt: Nyuma y'aho, abafataga amafoto bafashe ikibanza cy'umugore wari ugeze mu za bukuru wari ukeneye kujya mu cyuho.

src: Liggins followed in his father's footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
tgt: Liggins yakurikije urugero rwa se maze akora ubuvuzi.

src: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
tgt: Yigiye kuba umuganga w'imbyaro, maze mu mwaka wa 1959 atangira gukora mu Bitaro by'Abagore byo muri Auckland.

src: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
tgt: Mu gihe yakoraga mu bitaro, Liggins yatangiye gukora ubushakashatsi ku birebana n'imbyaro z'abana batwite igihe kitaragera mu gihe yari afite umwanya.

src: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi bwe bwagaragaje ko iyo umwana yahawe homoni, iyo homoni yazamura umuvuduko w'ubwonko bw'umwana.

src: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
tgt: Ikinyamakuru Xinhua cyatangaje ko abakora iperereza ku byaha by'indege mu gihugu cya Koreya ya Ruguru, basanze ibyuma bibiri by'ikoranabuhanga byitwa 'black box'.

src: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
tgt: Abakinnyi bagenzi be na bo bashimiye Luna.

src: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
tgt: Tommy Dreamer yagize ati "Luna yari umwamikazi wa mbere wa Extreme. Umuyobozi wanjye wa mbere. Luna yapfuye mu ijoro ry'amezi abiri. Yari umuntu udasanzwe nka we. Umugore ukomeye. "

src: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
tgt: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels yagize ati "Luna yari afite ubwoba nk'ubwanjye...ndetse wenda n'ubwinshi kurushaho...namukundaga kandi nzamwibagirwa... nizeye ko ari ahantu heza".

src: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
tgt: Ku bantu 1.400 babajijwe mbere y'amatora yo mu mwaka wa 2010, umubare w'abatavuga rumwe n'uko Ostraliya izaba repuburika wiyongereyeho 8 ku ijana kuva mu mwaka wa 2008.

src: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
tgt: Minisitiri w'Intebe wungirije Julia Gillard yavuze mu gihe cy'amatora yo mu mwaka wa 2010 ko yizeye ko Australia yagombye kuba repubulika ku iherezo ry'ubutegetsi bwa Queen Elizabeth II .

src: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
tgt: Abantu 34 ku ijana bitabiriye iryo koraniro na bo bafite iyo myifatire, kandi bifuza ko Umwamikazi Elizabeth wa Kabiri aba umwami wa nyuma w'u Bwongereza.

src: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
tgt: Mu bushakashatsi bwakozwe, 29 ku ijana by'ababajijwe bemera ko Ostraliya yagombye kuba repuburika vuba bishoboka, mu gihe 31 ku ijana bemera ko Ostraliya itazigera na rimwe iba repuburika.

src: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
tgt: Uyu mukinnyi watsindiye umudali w'izahabu mu mikino ya Olempike yagombaga kuririmba mu mikino ya 100m na 200m mu buryo bw'umwuga ndetse no mu mikino itatu ya Commonwealth Games, ariko bitewe n'ibikomere bye, ubushobozi bwe bwagaragaye budafite ishema.

src: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
tgt: Ntiyashoboraga gufata imiti yagombaga kumufasha guhangana n'umubabaro yari afite kubera ko iyo miti itemewe mu mikino.

src: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
tgt: Curtis Cooper, umuhanga mu by'ibarurishamibare akaba n'umwarimu mu by'ikoranabuhanga muri Kaminuza ya Central Missouri, yavumbuye ku itariki ya 25 Mutarama umubare munini cyane kurusha indi yose yigeze kuboneka.

src: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
tgt: Abantu benshi basuzumye ubwo bushakashatsi bakoresheje ibikoresho by'ikoranabuhanga bitandukanye mu ntangiriro za Gashyantare kandi byatangajwe kuwa Kabiri.

src: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
tgt: Birashoboka ko izo nyenyeri ari zo zatumye amazi atembera ku isi hamwe n'ibinyabuzima by'ibinyabuzima bishobora gukora poroteyine no gutuma ubuzima bubaho.

src: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
tgt: Abahanga mu bya siyansi bifuza gusobanukirwa uko planeti zakomotse, by'umwihariko uko isi yakomotse, kubera ko za nyenyeri zahuye n'isi kera cyane.

src: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
tgt: Cuomo w'imyaka 53, yatangiye kuyobora guverinoma mu ntangiriro z'uyu mwaka kandi mu kwezi gushize yashyize umukono ku itegeko ryemewe n'amategeko rishyira mu bikorwa ishyingiranwa ry'abahuje ibitsina.

src: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness."
tgt: Yavuze ko ayo makuru ari "amagambo y'ubupfu yo mu rwego rw'ubutegetsi".

src: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
tgt: Biteganyijwe ko azatsinda amatora ya Perezida mu 2016.

src: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
tgt: NextGen ni uburyo FAA ivuga ko bwemerera indege gukora ingendo ngufi kandi bikanazigama miliyari z'amalitiro y'ibikomoka kuri peteroli buri mwaka kandi bikanagabanya imyuka itera ubushyuhe.

src: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
tgt: Ikoresha ikoranabuhanga rishingiye kuri satellite aho gukoresha ikoranabuhanga rya kera rishingiye kuri radar yo ku butaka, kugira ngo abagenzuzi b'indege bashobore kumenya neza aho indege ziri no guha abagenzi amakuru asobanutse neza.

src: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
tgt: Nta modoka zindi zizashyirwa ku kibuga cya Wembley, kandi nta gari ya moshi izahagarara ku kibuga cya Wembley, nta n'aho imodoka zizajya zihagarara.

src: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
tgt: Ubwoba bw'uko nta modoka zizaba zitwara abakinnyi, bwatumye habaho igitekerezo cy'uko umukino wari gukinirwa mu rugo nta bafana b'iyi kipe.

src: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi bwanditswe ku wa kane mu kinyamakuru cyitwa Science, bwavuze ko mu birwa bya Galápagos byo muri Équateur habayeho ubwoko bushya bw'inyoni.

src: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
tgt: Abashakashatsi bo muri Kaminuza ya Princeton yo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe za Amerika na Kaminuza ya Uppsala yo mu Busuwisi batangaje ko ubwoko bushya bwagaragaye mu gihe cy'imiryango ibiri gusa, nubwo byatekerezwaga ko iki gikorwa cyafataga igihe kirekire, bitewe n'ubwiyunge hagati ya finch ya Darwin, Geospiza fortes, na finch ya cactus y'abimukira, Geospiza conirostris.

src: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
tgt: Amabara y'izahabu ashobora kuba afite imiterere itandukanye, kandi ashobora gukoreshwa mu gukora ibintu by'ubwoko bwose.

src: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
tgt: Bashobora kuyikubita kugira ngo igire umugozi muke, bayikubita cyangwa bayikubita kugira ngo igire udupfunyika.

src: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts."
tgt: Ashobora kuba ari muto cyane ku buryo rimwe na rimwe yakoreshwaga mu gushushanya amashusho yabaga ari mu bitabo byitwa "ibitabo byandikishijwe intoki byashusanyijwe".

src: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
tgt: Ibyo ni byo bita pH y'ikinyabiziga.

src: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
tgt: Umutobe w'ibishyimbo uhinduka ibara hakurikijwe urugero rw'umuvuduko w'umuvuduko wa asidi cyangwa wa baziki (alkali).

src: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
tgt: Icyiciro cya pH kigaragazwa n'umubare w'imyuka ya Hydrogène (H muri pH) iri mu kiremwa kimera kigeragezwa.

src: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
tgt: Iyon ya hidirojeni ni protoni zifite za elektroni zazimukanwe (kuko atomu ya hidirojeni igizwe na protoni imwe na elektroni imwe).

src: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
tgt: Jya ushyiramo utwo dukunguru twombi twumye, maze ukoreshe intoki zihumanye kandi zishyushye, maze ubikureho umupira.

src: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
tgt: Umwotsi uri ku ntoki zawe uzagira ingaruka n'ibice by'inyuma, bigahinduka nk'igishushanyo.

src: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
tgt: Mu mijyi ya Harappa n'iya Mohenjo-daro, hafi buri nzu yabaga ifite inzu y'isuku y'amazi, kandi yabaga ifitanye isano n'umuyoboro w'isuku wagutse.

src: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
tgt: Mu mazu yo mu mijyi y'i Krete n'i Santorini yo mu Bugiriki yo mu gihe cya Minoiki, basanze ibisigarira by'inzira z'amazi.

src: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'ubutegetsi bw'Abaroma, rimwe na rimwe inzu z'isuku zari mu mazu y'ubwiherero y'abantu bose, aho abagabo n'abagore babaga bari kumwe.

src: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
tgt: Iyo uhamagara umuntu uri ku birometero ibihumbi n'ibihumbi uherereye, uba ukoresha isatelite.

src: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
tgt: Satellite iri mu isanzure ibona iryo jambo, maze igasubiza mu kirere, hafi mu kanya gato.

src: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
tgt: Abahanga mu bya siyansi bakoresha za telesikope zo mu kirere kubera ko ikirere cy'isi kigenda gihindura umucyo n'uko tubona.

src: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
tgt: Kugira ngo satellite cyangwa telesikope ijye mu kirere, hakenerwa roketi nini cyane ifite uburebure burenga metero 100.

src: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
tgt: Ikintu cy'ingenzi cyane cyagize ingaruka kuri twe, ni uko bitworohera gutwara ibinyabiziga kandi tukabikora vuba cyane.

src: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
tgt: Yadufashije kubona gari ya moshi, imodoka n'ibindi bikoresho byinshi byo gutwara abantu.

src: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
tgt: Nyuma y'izo nyamaswa hari izindi nyamaswa z'ubwoko buri hagati, zirya inyama z'ubwoko buri hagati, uhereye ku nkoko ukageza ku nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa antelope n'izo mu bwoko bw'intama.

src: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
tgt: Amaherezo, hari amakote manini menshi (harimo n'amakote yo mu rugo) arya amakote manini menshi cyane, urugero nk'inzige, ibimonyo, ibishwi n'inyoni.

src: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
tgt: Igikuru cy'uko bigira icyo bigeraho, ni uko buri nyamaswa iba ifite umurimo wihariye idashobora guhatana n'indi.

src: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
tgt: Intare ni zo nyamaswa zikunda kwifatanya n'abandi cyane, kuko ziba mu matsinda manini yitwa amatorero.

src: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
tgt: Iyo miryango igizwe n'abagabo bakuze b'imiryango imwe kugeza kuri itatu, hamwe n'abagore n'abana bagera kuri mirongo itatu.

src: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
tgt: Aba bagore akenshi baba bafitanye isano ya bugufi, bakaba umuryango munini w'abavandimwe na bashiki babo b'abakobwa.

src: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
tgt: Ingabo z'intare zigenza nk'intare z'impene cyangwa iz'imbwa, inyamaswa zihuje n'intare mu buryo butangaje (ariko atari izindi nyamaswa zikomeye) mu myifatire, kandi kandi zica cyane ibishyimbo byazo.

src: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
tgt: Inyoni ni umukinnyi w'imikino, kandi ishobora kuruka (nubwo idashobora kuruka neza), kurira, kuruka ibirometero byinshi, kandi ikanafata ibintu n'imbaraga zingana n'iz'umuntu inshuro eshanu.

src: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
tgt: Inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa Panthera, zirimo intare, ingwe n'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa jaguar, ni zo zonyine zishobora kurira.

src: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
tgt: Urwamo rw'intare ntirugereranywa n'urw'intare, ahubwo rugereranywa n'amagambo y'amagambo arangwa n'agahinda.

src: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
tgt: Inzovu zikunda kurya inyamaswa ntoya, kuko zishobora kuroba ingwe, inzoka, ibikoko n'inyoni.

src: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
tgt: Abahanga mu bya siyansi batekereza ko izo nyoni zikurikira inyamaswa kandi zikaziha ibyokurya (ibikoko) bitewe n'umuvuduko zihumeka, zihumeka aho zigeze kuba ku butaka.

src: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
tgt: Izo nyamaswa zishobora kubona neza mu mwijima bitewe n'uko zibona mu ijoro, kandi zishobora no kugenda mu buryo bw'amahirwe.

src: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
tgt: Iyo itsinda rito ry'ibinyabuzima (igitigiri gito cy'abaturage) ryitandukanyije n'igitigiri kinini cy'abaturage bavuyeho (nk'iyo bavuye mu misozi cyangwa mu ruzi, cyangwa iyo bavuye mu kirwa gishya ku buryo badashobora kugaruka mu buryo bworoshye) akenshi bazajya babonera ahantu hatandukanye n'aho babaga mbere.

src: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
tgt: Iyi mibereho mishya ifite uburyo butandukanye n'abakinnyi batandukanye, ku bw'ibyo abaturage bashya bazaba bakeneye imiterere itandukanye cyangwa guhinduka kugira ngo babe abakinnyi bakomeye kurusha uko bari bakeneye mbere.

src: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
tgt: Abaturage bo mu ntangiriro ntabwo bahindutse na gato, baracyakeneye guhinduka nk'uko byari bimeze mbere.

src: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
tgt: Uko igihe kigenda gihita, uko abantu bashya batangira kwiyumvisha imimerere bashya barimo, ni ko batangira kumera nk'abandi bantu.

src: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
tgt: Amaherezo, nyuma y'imyaka ibarirwa mu bihumbi cyangwa se muri za miriyoni, ibyo binyabuzima byombi bizaba bitandukanye cyane ku buryo bitazongera kwitwa ubwoko bumwe.

src: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
tgt: Iyo mibereho tuyita iterambere ry'ubwoko bw'ibinyabuzima, risobanura gusa ko habaho ubwoko bushya bw'ibinyabuzima.

src: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
tgt: Ibimera bikora umwuka w'umwuka abantu bihumeka, kandi bifata umwuka w'umwuka w'umwuka (carbon dioxide) abantu bihumeka.

src: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
tgt: Ibimera bikoresha imirasire y'izuba kugira ngo bigire ibyo birya, kandi bituma habaho igicu.

src: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
tgt: Twubaka amazu dukoresheje ibimera, twubaka imyenda dukoresheje ibimera, kandi ibiryo byinshi turya ni ibimera. Iyo nta bimera, inyamaswa ntizashoboraga kubaho.

src: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
tgt: Mu gihe cyacyo, inyamaswa yitwa mosasaurus ni yo yari inyamaswa yo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa.

src: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
tgt: Inzovu zayo ndende zari zifite amenyo arenga 70 akomeye cyane, kandi zari zifite n'andi amenyo yo hejuru y'akanwa kazo, ibyo bikaba byasobanuraga ko nta kintu na kimwe cyageraga mu nzira yacyo cyagombaga kurokoka.

src: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
tgt: Ntituzi neza, ariko bishobora kuba byari bifite ururimi rwahindutse impande ebyiri, kandi byashoboraga kurya ibinyampeke, amafi manini, n'ibindi binyabuzima byitwa mosasaurs, ndetse bikaba bishoboka ko byashoboraga kurya abantu.

src: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
tgt: Nanone yarwanyaga ikintu icyo ari cyo cyose cyageraga mu mazi; ndetse n'inyamaswa y'igihangange nk'iyo bita T. rex ntiyari gushobora kuyirwanya.

src: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
tgt: Nubwo ibyokurya by'Abaroma benshi twari tuzi, na bo bari bafite ibyokurya bitangaje, urugero nk'ingurube z'inkazi, ibishwi, inyenyeri n'ikinyabutabire cyitwa dormouse.

src: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
tgt: Ikindi kintu cyatandukanyaga abakene n'abo bagore, ni uko abakene n'abo bagore bakundaga kurya bicaye ku ntebe, mu gihe abakire na bo bakundaga kujya hamwe mu birori, bakicara impande zombi mu gihe bari kurya.

src: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
tgt: Mu biribwa by'Abaroma bo mu gihe cya kera, ntihashobora kuba hari ibiribwa byinjiye mu Burayi bivuye muri Amerika cyangwa muri Aziya mu binyejana byakurikiye.

src: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
tgt: Urugero, ntibari bafite ingano, cyangwa amatomati, cyangwa intete, cyangwa kakao, kandi nta Muroma wa kera wari warigeze anywa inka.

src: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
tgt: Abantu b'i Babuloni bubatse urusengero rw'ibanze rwubatswe ngo rube icyicaro cya buri mana yabo.

src: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
tgt: Abantu batangaga ibitambo ku mana, kandi abatambyi bageragezaga kwita ku byo imana zari zikeneye binyuriye mu birori n'imihango.

src: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
tgt: Buri rusengero rwari rugizwe n'urugo rw'urusengero rwari rwaragutse, n'ahantu heza h'imbere aho abaherezi bonyine bashoboraga kwinjira.

src: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
tgt: Rimwe na rimwe, mu byumba by'urusengero habaga hari inyubako z'igiciro kinini zari zifite imiterere nk'iya piramidi.

src: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
tgt: Uruhande rw'iburyo rw'uwo mugezi rwari ahantu heza cyane ho kuramya iyo mana.

src: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
tgt: Kubera ko mu Burasirazuba bwo Hagati hari ubushyuhe, iyo nzu ntiyari ifite agaciro.

src: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
tgt: Ibyinshi mu bikorwa by'umuryango w'Abaheburayo byabaga hanze.

src: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
tgt: Abagore batangiraga ibyokurya mu rugo; ibigo by'ubucuruzi byari ibyumba by'ubucuruzi byari byuzuye, bigira amaso ku muhanda.

src: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
tgt: Mu gihugu cya Kanani nta mashyamba manini yariho, ku bw'ibyo ibiti byari bihenze cyane.

src: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
tgt: Mu migani ya Norvege bavuga ko Erik the Red yajyanywe mu bunyage avuye muri Islande kubera ubwicanyi, kandi ubwo yagendaga mu burengerazuba, yabonye Greenland maze akayita Greenland.

src: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
tgt: Ariko kandi, ibyo yabonye ntabyo byari bifite icyo bivuze, kuko muri icyo gihe abantu bo mu bwoko bw'Abaeskimo bari bamaze kuba muri icyo gihugu.

src: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
tgt: Nubwo buri gihugu cyari 'icya Scandinavie', hari ibintu byinshi byari bitandukanye hagati y'abantu, abami, imigenzo n'amateka bya Danemark, Suwede, Norvège na Islande.

src: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
tgt: Niba warigeze kureba filimi yitwa National Treasure, ushobora gutekereza ko hari ikarita y'ubutunzi yanditswe inyuma y'Inyandiko y'Ubwigenge.

src: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
tgt: Nubwo hari ikintu cyanditswe inyuma y'icyo gitabo, si ikarita y'ubutunzi.

src: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776." The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
tgt: Ku ruhande rw'inyuma rw'iryo tangazo ry'ubwigenge hari amagambo agira ati "Itangiriro ry'iryo tangazo ry'ubwigenge ryo ku itariki ya 4 Nyakanga 1776. "

src: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 293⁄4 inches by 241⁄2 inches) was rolled up for storage.
tgt: N'ubwo nta muntu uzi neza uwayanditse, birazwi ko mu ntangiriro z'ubuzima bwe, iyo nyandiko nini y'amababa (yari ifite uburebure bwa santimetero 293⁄4 n'uburebure bwa santimetero 241⁄2), yari yakubitiwe kugira ngo itunganywe.

src: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
tgt: Ku bw'ibyo rero, birashoboka ko iryo jambo ryongewemo gusa kugira ngo rishyireho ikimenyetso.

src: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
tgt: Imirwano yo ku munsi wa D hamwe n'indi yakurikiyeho yari yarekuye igice cy'amajyaruguru y'u Bufaransa, ariko igice cy'amajyepfo cyari kitarabohoka.

src: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
tgt: Icyo gihugu cyari kiyobowe n'Abafaransa bo mu bwoko bwa "Vichy", ni ukuvuga Abafaransa bari baragiranye amahoro n'Abadage mu mwaka wa 1940 kandi bakoranaga n'abo barwanyi aho kurwana na bo.

src: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon."
tgt: Ku itariki ya 15 Kanama 1940, ingabo z'Abanyaburayi n'iz'Abasoviyeti zateye mu majyepfo y'u Bufaransa, icyo gitero kikaba cyiswe "Intambara ya Dragoon".

src: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
tgt: Mu byumweru bibiri gusa, ingabo z'Abanyamerika n'iz'u Bufaransa bwigenga zari zarasohotse mu majyepfo y'u Bufaransa, kandi zari zigiye ku ruhande rw'Ubudage.

src: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
tgt: Ubukungu ni umuco w'abantu benshi cyane babaho kandi bakorera hamwe, ni ukuvuga umuryango.

src: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
tgt: Ijambo civilis rivuye mu kilatini civilis, risobanura civil, rikomoka ku kilatini civis, risobanura umuturage, na civitas, risobanura umujyi cyangwa leta y'umujyi, kandi na ryo mu buryo runaka ryerekana uburebure bw'umuryango.

src: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
tgt: Imiryango yo mu mijyi ni yo yatangiriye ishyirwaho ry'amahanga. Umudendezo w'iterambere usobanura ko ubumenyi bwigishwa n'imiryango myinshi, umuco ugakomeza kubaho no gukwirakwizwa mu buryo bukwiriye.

src: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
tgt: Akenshi imico y'abantu itagira aho ihuriye n'ubutegetsi bw'abantu, irazimira nta kimenyetso cy'amateka kigaragaza ko yariho, kandi ntiyemerwa nk'imico yagutse.

src: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government - with the Congress being its only component - under the Articles of Confederation.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'Intambara yo Kwibohora, leta cumi n'eshatu za mbere zarashyizeho leta y'ibanze idakomeye - mu gihe Inteko Ishinga Amategeko ari yo yari igice cyonyine cyayo - hakurikijwe Amategeko y'Ubumwe.

src: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
tgt: Inteko Ishinga Amategeko nta bubasha yari ifite bwo gushyiraho imisoro, kandi kubera ko nta rwego rw'igihugu rw'ubutegetsi cyangwa urw'ubucamanza rwariho, yari ishingiye ku bayobozi ba leta, akenshi bakaba batagiraga ubufatanye, kugira ngo bashyire mu bikorwa amategeko yayo yose.

src: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
tgt: Nanone kandi, nta bubasha yari afite bwo kurenga ku mategeko agenga imisoro n'imisoro hagati y'ibihugu.

src: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
tgt: Iyo ngingo yasabaga ko intara zose zishyiriraho umukono umwe mbere y'uko zishobora guhindurwa, kandi intara zatekerezaga ko leta y'ibanze ari ntoya cyane ku buryo abahagarariye intara akenshi babaga batari bahari.

src: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
tgt: Ikipe y'igihugu y'umupira w'amaguru y'u Butaliyani, hamwe n'ikipe y'igihugu y'umupira w'amaguru y'u Budage, ni yo kipe ya kabiri ikomeye ku isi kandi ni yo yabaye igikombe cy'isi cya FIFA mu 2006.

src: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
tgt: Mu mikino ikundwa cyane harimo umupira w'amaguru, basketball, volley-ball, water-polo, gucuranga, rugby, kugendera ku magare, ice hockey, roller hockey na F1 motor racing.

src: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
tgt: Imikino yo mu gihe cy'imbeho ni yo ikundwa cyane mu turere tw'Amajyaruguru, aho Abataliyani bakina imikino mpuzamahanga n'imikino ya Olempike.

src: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
tgt: Ubuyapani bugizwe n'ibirwa bigera hafi ku 7.000 (Ikiyaga cya Honshu ni cyo kinini kurusha ibindi), bikaba bituma Ubuyapani buza ku mwanya wa karindwi mu bihugu bifite ibirwa byinshi kurusha ibindi ku isi!

src: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
tgt: Kubera ko u Buyapani buri n'ubwiyongere bw'ibirwa, akenshi u Buyapani buvugwa ko ari "umwobo w'ibirwa"

src: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island's name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
tgt: Taiwan yatangiriye mu kinyejana cya 15, igihe abacuruzi b'inyanja b'Abanyaburayi bageraga kuri icyo kirwa, bandikaga izina ry'icyo kirwa ko ari Ilha Formosa, cyangwa kirwa cyiza.

src: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1624, Ikigo cy'Ubuholandi cy'u Buhinde bw'iburasirazuba cyashyizeho icyicaro mu majyepfo ashyira uburengerazuba bwa Taiwan, gitangira guhindura imikorere y'abatuye ubutaka yo kurima imbuto no gukoresha abakozi b'Abashinwa gukora mu mirima yayo y'umuceri n'isukari.

src: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1683, ingabo z'abami bo mu muryango wa Qing (1644-1912) zatwaye ibice byo mu burengerazuba n'uburasirazuba bwa Taiwan, maze mu mwaka wa 1885 zivuga ko Taiwan ari intara y'Ubwami bwa Qing.

src: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1895, nyuma yo gutsindwa mu ntambara ya mbere hagati y'u Bushinwa n'u Buyapani (1894-1895), leta ya Qing yashyize umukono ku masezerano ya Shimonoseki, mu buryo bw'uko yahaye Ubuyapani ubutegetsi ku kirwa cya Taïwan, bukaba bwategetse iki kirwa kugeza mu wa 1945.

src: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
tgt: Mu mugi wa Machu Picchu hari inyubako eshatu z'ingenzi, ari zo Intihuatana, urusengero rw'izuba, n'icyumba gifite amadirisha atatu.

src: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
tgt: Inyubako nyinshi ziri ku nkengero z'iyo nyubako zarubatswe kugira ngo abashyitsi basobanukirwe neza ukuntu zari zimeze mu ntangiriro.

src: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1976, ibice mirongo itatu ku ijana by'umujyi wa Machu Picchu byari byarasubijweho, kandi kugeza n'uyu munsi baracyakomeza kuwusubizaho.

src: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
tgt: Urugero, uburyo bwo gufata amashusho bukoreshwa cyane ku isi ni 35mm, ubwo bukaba ari bwo bwari bukoreshwa cyane mu gufata amashusho mu mpera z'igihe cy'amashusho ya analog.

src: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
tgt: N'ubu iracyakorwa, ariko icy'ingenzi kurushaho, ni uko ububiko bwayo bw'imiterere bwarazwe n'imiterere y'imiterere y'amashusho ya kamera ya digital.

src: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
tgt: Mu by'ukuri, imiterere ya 35mm, mu buryo budasanzwe, ifite ubugari bwa 36mm n'ubugari bwa 24mm.

src: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
tgt: Ku bw'ibyo, igipimo cy'imiterere y'iyi porogaramu (kugabura ku icumi n'ibiri kugira ngo haboneke igipimo cyoroheje cyane cy'umubare wose) bivugwa ko ari 3: 2.

src: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
tgt: Amashusho menshi asanzwe (urugero, umuryango wa APS wa mashusho) aringana cyangwa agera hafi y'iyi mibare.

src: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
tgt: Itegeko ry'ibice bitatu, ryakoreshwa nabi cyane kandi rikunze gusekwa, ni itegeko ryoroshye rigira uruhare mu gutuma igishushanyo kigira imbaraga, mu gihe kizigama urutonde.

src: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
tgt: Igaragaza ko ahantu heza cyane ho gushyira umutwe w'igishushanyo ari aho imigenderanire y'amabara agabanya igishushanyo mu bice bitatu mu buryo bw'ikigereranyo no mu buryo bw'ibanga (reba urugero).

src: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
tgt: Muri icyo gihe cy'amateka y'i Burayi, Kiliziya Gatolika, yari imaze kuba umutunzi kandi ifite ububasha, yaje gusuzumwa.

src: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
tgt: Mu gihe cy'imyaka irenga igihumbi, idini rya Gikristo ryashyize hamwe ibihugu by'i Burayi, n'ubwo byari bifite ururimi n'imigenzo bitandukanye.

src: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
tgt: Ububasha bwawo bwashyize abantu bose mu kaga, uhereye ku bami kugeza ku bantu b'ingeri rusange.

src: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
tgt: Imwe mu nyigisho z'ibanze z'Abakristo ni iy'uko ubutunzi bukwiriye gukoreshwa mu kugabanya imibabaro n'ubukene, kandi ko ayo mafaranga ya kiliziya agenewe iyo ntego.

src: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
tgt: Ubutegetsi bw'ibanze bw'idini bwari bumaze imyaka irenga igihumbi buri i Roma, kandi kuba ubutegetsi n'amafaranga byari byibumbiye hamwe byatumye abantu benshi bibaza niba iyo nyigisho yari ikurikizwa.

src: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
tgt: Bidatinze nyuma y'aho intambara itangiye, Ubwongereza bwatangiye gufunga u Budage mu mazi.

src: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
tgt: Icyo cyemezo cyagize ingaruka nziza, kuko cyahagaritse serivisi z'ingenzi za gisirikare n'iz'abasivile, n'ubwo icyo gihagararo cyahwanye n'amategeko mpuzamahanga yemewe n'abantu benshi, yashyizwe mu masezerano menshi mpuzamahanga yo mu binyejana bibiri bishize.

src: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
tgt: Ubwongereza bwashyize amasasu mu mazi mpuzamahanga kugira ngo butabuza ubwato ubwo ari bwo bwose kwinjira mu bice bimwe by'inyanja, bigatera akaga n'ubwato butagira aho buherereye.

src: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
tgt: Kubera ko ubwo buryo bwashyizwe mu bikorwa mu rugero ruto, Ubudage bwari bwiteze ko n'intambara yabwo yo mu mazi yo mu nyanja itazongera gufatwa mu buryo nk'ubwo.

src: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
tgt: Mu myaka ya 1920, imyifatire y'abaturage benshi n'ibihugu byari byiganje, yari iy'abashaka amahoro n'abashaka kwigunga.

src: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
tgt: Mu gihe Intambara ya Mbere y'Isi Yose yatangiraga, amahanga amaze kubona ibintu by'agahomamunwa n'urugomo byaranzwe n'intambara, yashakaga kwirinda ko ibintu nk'ibyo byongera kubaho.

src: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1884, Tesla yimukiye muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika kugira ngo yemere akazi muri sosiyete ya Edison yo mu mujyi wa New York.

src: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
tgt: Yageze muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika afite amadolari 4 ku izina rye, igitabo cy'indirimbo, n'urwandiko rw'ishimwe rwa Charles Batchelor (umuyobozi we mu kazi yakoraga mbere) kuri Thomas Edison.

src: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
tgt: U Bushinwa bwa kera bwari bufite uburyo bwihariye bwo kugaragaza ibihe bitandukanye; buri gice cy'u Bushinwa cyangwa buri muryango wari ku butegetsi, wari urugo rw'abami rwari rwihariye.

src: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
tgt: Nanone kandi, hagati y'ubwami bwa Han n'ubwo bwa Jin harabayeho igihe cy'ihungabana ry'ibice by'intara. Icyo gihe kizwi cyane ni igihe cy'Ingoma eshatu cyamaze imyaka 60.

src: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
tgt: Muri icyo gihe, abantu benshi b'abanyacyubahiro barwanaga urugamba rukomeye rwo kurwanira intebe y'umwami.

src: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China's history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi'an.
tgt: Mu mateka y'Ubushinwa bwa kera, igihe cy'Ingoma eshatu ni cyo gihe abantu babarirwa mu bihumbi bapfiriye mu ntambara yo gushaka umwanya wo hejuru cyane mu ngoro nini y'i Xi'an.

src: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
tgt: Hari ingaruka nyinshi zo mu rwego rw'imibereho myiza no mu bya politiki, urugero nko gukoresha uburyo bwo gupima, kuva ku butegetsi bw'igitugu ku butegetsi bw'igitugu, gukunda igihugu no kwemera ko igihugu ari icy'abaturage aho kuba icy'umutegetsi umwe.

src: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
tgt: Nanone kandi, nyuma y'Iterabwoba, abagabo bose bashoboraga kwiyamamariza akazi, bityo abafite intego n'ubushobozi bwo kugera ku ntego zabo, bakaba baratsinze.

src: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
tgt: Ibyo ni ko bimeze no mu gisirikare, kuko aho kugira ngo abasirikare bashyirwe mu byiciro, ubu bashyirwaga mu byiciro by'abagabo.

src: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
tgt: Nanone kandi, iyo revolisiyo y'Abafaransa yatumye n'abandi bantu benshi bo mu miryango y'abakozi bo mu bindi bihugu bari mu bucakara, batangira revolisiyo zabo bwite.

src: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as "Hira'" on the Mountain of "Noor" (light) for contemplation.
tgt: Muhammad yakundaga kujya mu rwobo rwitwa "Hira'" ruri ku musozi wa "Noor" (umucyo) kugira ngo asuzume ibintu.

src: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations.
tgt: Iyo nyenga ubwayo, yashoboye kurokoka icyo gihe, itanga ishusho igaragara cyane y'ibyifuzo bya roho bya Muhammad.

src: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
tgt: Iyo nyenga iri hejuru y'umusozi uri mu majyaruguru y'umujyi wa Mecca, kandi nta muntu n'umwe uyigeraho.

src: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
tgt: Mu by'ukuri, iyo umuntu amenye ko hari uruzitiro, ntiyoroherwa na gato no kurubona, kuko iyo ari mu rwobo aba ari wenyine.

src: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
tgt: Nta kintu na kimwe gishobora kuboneka uretse ijuru ryera, ryiza cyane, n'imisozi myinshi iri hafi yaho.

src: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
tgt: Piramide nini yo muri Gizeh ni yo yonyine muri ibyo bintu birindwi bitangaje ikiriho.

src: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
tgt: Pyramide Nkuru yubatswe n'Abanyamisiri mu kinyejana cya gatatu M.I.C., ni imwe mu nyubako nyinshi z'ipiramide nini zubatse mu rwego rwo guha icyubahiro Farawo wapfuye.

src: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
tgt: Mu Kibaya cya Giza, cyangwa "Giza Necropolis" kiri mu Kibaya cy'Abapfuye cyo muri Egiputa, hari piramide nyinshi (mu zo piramide nini ni yo nini cyane), imva ntoya nyinshi, insengero nyinshi, hamwe n'igishushanyo kinini cya Sphinx.

src: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
tgt: Piramide nini yubatswe mu rwego rwo guha icyubahiro Farawo Khufu, kandi nyinshi mu za piramide ntoya, imva n'insengero byubatswe mu rwego rwo guha icyubahiro abagore ba Khufu n'abo mu muryango we.

src: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
tgt: Igishushanyo kigira kiti "igishushanyo cyo hejuru" gisa n'igishushanyo kigira kiti "igishushanyo cyo hasi" gisa n'igishushanyo kigira kiti "igishushanyo cyo hasi" gisa n'igishushanyo kigira kiti "igishushanyo cyo hasi".

src: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
tgt: Kujya hejuru bisobanura ko ugomba gutangira ku nkombe maze ugateza umuheto, no hasi bisobanura ko ugomba gutangira ku mbogo (aho ukuboko kwawe gufashe umuheto) maze ugateza umuheto.

src: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
tgt: Ubusanzwe umurongo uvuye hejuru ugaragaza ijwi ryoroshye, mu gihe umurongo uvuye hasi ugaragaza ijwi rikomeye kandi ryumvikana neza.

src: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
tgt: Uramutse ubishaka, jya ubyandikaho, ariko wibuke ko ibimenyetso by'amabanga y'indirimbo biriho kubera impamvu y'umuziki, ku bw'ibyo, akenshi bigomba kwubahirizwa.

src: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
tgt: Umwami Louis XVI wari ufite ubwoba, Umwamikazi Marie Antoinette n'abana babo babiri bakiri bato (Marie Therese w'imyaka 11 na Louis-Charles w'imyaka ine) hamwe na mushiki w'Umwami, Madame Elizabeth, ku itariki ya 6 Ukwakira 1789 bahindutse i Paris bavuye i Versailles bihatirwa n'itsinda ry'abagore bo ku isoko.

src: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
tgt: Basubiye i Paris bari mu modoka, bakikijwe n'itsinda ry'abantu baririmbaga bavuga ko Umwami n'Umwamikazi bazabaho nabi.

src: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
tgt: Icyo kivunge cy'abantu cyatumye Umwami n'Umwamikazi bashyira amadirishya y'imodoka yabo mu buryo bukomeye.

src: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
tgt: Igihe kimwe, umwe mu bari bagize icyo kivunge yafashe umutwe w'umurinzi w'umwami wishwe i Versailles imbere y'umwamikazi wari utinye cyane.

src: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
tgt: Amafaranga yakoreshejwe n'ubutegetsi bwa Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika mu ntambara yo kwigarurira Filipine, yakoreshejwe n'abaturage ba Filipine ubwabo.

src: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
tgt: Bahatirwaga kwishyura imisoro ku butegetsi bw'abakoloni b'Amerika kugira ngo batangaze igice kinini cy'amafaranga bakoreshaga hamwe n'umusaruro w'amabanki ya Wall Street yakoreshwaga mu izina ry'ubutegetsi bwa Philippines.

src: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
tgt: Birumvikana ko inyungu zikomeye zivuye mu kunyereza abantu bo muri Filipine byari kuba inyungu z'ibanze z'ubutware bw'Amerika.

src: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
tgt: Kugira ngo umuntu asobanukirwe iby'Abatambyi b'Ingoro y'Imana, agomba gusobanukirwa imimerere yatumye iryo tsinda ryubakwa.

src: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000-1300).
tgt: Icyo gihe cy'amateka y'u Burayi cyabaye mu kinyejana cya 11, cya 12 n'icya 13 (1000-1300 I.C.).

src: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
tgt: Igihe cy'Imyaka yo Hagati cyaje imbere y'igihe cy'Imyaka yo Hagati ya Mbere, maze kigakurikirwa n'igihe cy'Imyaka yo Hagati ya nyuma, kigomba kurangira nko mu mwaka wa 1500.

src: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
tgt: Iterambere ry'ikoranabuhanga ni ijambo rihuriza hamwe ibitekerezo byinshi mu bikorwa, uhereye ku ikoreshwa ry'ikoranabuhanga cyangwa ikoreshwa ry'ikoranabuhanga ku buryo bukomeye ko ejo hazaza h'umuntu hashingiwe ku mahame y'ibanze afitanye isano n'amategeko ya siyansi n'igaragara ryayo muri tekiniki.

src: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
tgt: Ibisobanuro byinshi bya determinism ya tekiniki bifitanye ibitekerezo bibiri rusange: ko iterambere ry'ikoranabuhanga ubwaryo rikurikira inzira irenze cyane ingaruka z'umuco cyangwa za politiki, kandi ko ikoranabuhanga na ryo rifite "ingaruka" ku mibereho y'abantu, aho gushyirwa mu by'imibereho.

src: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
tgt: Urugero, umuntu ashobora kuvuga ko imodoka ari yo ituma imihanda irushaho kumvikana.

src: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
tgt: Icyakora, kugira imihanda yo mu gihugu cyose ntibishobora gutuma imodoka nkeya zibaho, ku bw'ibyo, hakorwa uburyo bushya bwo gukora imodoka kugira ngo ibiciro by'imodoka bigabanuke.

src: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
tgt: Kuba abantu benshi bafite imodoka kandi bituma habaho impanuka nyinshi mu mihanda, bituma hakorwa ubuhanga bushya mu bijyanye n'ubuvuzi bwo gukosora imibiri yakomeretse.

src: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
tgt: Igitabo cyitwa Romanticism cyari gifite igice kinini cy'umuco w'abanditsi nka Goethe, Fichte, na Schlegel.

src: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'ubushakashatsi bwitwa Romanticism, imiterere y'isi yahinduraga abantu, kandi uko igihe cyagendaga gihita, imico n'umuco bifitanye isano n'imiterere y'iyo si byaje kubaho, kandi ibyo, bitewe n'uko byari bifitanye isano n'imiterere y'imibereho y'abantu, byari byiza kurusha amategeko yashyizweho ku bushake.

src: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
tgt: Nk'uko i Paris izwiho kuba umurwa mukuru w'imyambaro y'isi ya none, ni na ko i Constantinople yabonwaga ko ari umurwa mukuru w'imyambaro y'ibihugu by'i Burayi byigenga.

src: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
tgt: Urwo rukiko rwatangiye kumenyekana ko ari ikicaro cy'ibintu by'igiciro cyinshi nko mu mwaka wa 400 I.C. kandi rwarakomeje kugeza nko mu wa 1100 I.C.

src: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
tgt: Mu kinyejana cya 12, agaciro kayo karaguye bitewe ahanini n'uko Abami b'Inkotanyi bari baragarutse bazanye impano, urugero nk'imyenda n'ibishyimbo, byari bifite agaciro karuta ayo abantu bo mu masoko yo muri Byzantium bari bafite.

src: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
tgt: Icyo gihe ni bwo izina ry'umurwa mukuru w'imyidagaduro ryahindutse riva i Constantinople rijya i Paris.

src: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
tgt: Umwimerere wa Gothik wagaragaye cyane hagati y'ikinyejana cya 10 n'icya 11 no mu kinyejana cya 14.

src: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
tgt: Mu mizo ya mbere, imyambaro yagenderwaga cyane n'umuco wa Byzantium wo mu burasirazuba.

src: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
tgt: Icyakora, bitewe n'uko uburyo bwo gushyikirana bwagendaga buhoro, imiterere yo mu burengerazuba yashoboraga gutinda inyuma imyaka 25 kugeza kuri 30.

src: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
tgt: mu mpera z'ikinyejana cya kabiri, u Burayi bw'uburengerazuba bwatangiye guteza imbere imiterere yabo bwite. kimwe mu bintu bikomeye byahindutse muri icyo gihe bitewe n'intambara z'amadini, abantu batangiye gukoresha imibonano kugira ngo bafate imyambaro.

src: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
tgt: Ubuhinzi bw'ubworozi ni ubuhinzi bukorwa mu rwego rwo gukora ibiribwa bihagije kugira ngo bishyure gusa ibyo umworozi n'umuryango we bakeneye.

src: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
tgt: Ubuhinzi bw'ibidukikije ni uburyo bworoshye, akenshi bw'ibinyabuzima, bukoresha imbuto z'ibinyabuzima ziterwa n'akarere hamwe no guhinduranya ibiterwa cyangwa ubundi buryo bworoshye bwo kongera umusaruro.

src: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
tgt: Mu mateka, abahinzi benshi bakoraga ubuhinzi kugira ngo baronke ibyokurya, kandi ni ko biri n'ubu mu bihugu byinshi bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere.

src: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
tgt: Ibice by'umuco bihuriza hamwe abantu bafite imitekerereze imwe bumva ko batitabwaho n'amahame y'imibereho, kandi bikabaha uburyo bwo kwiyumvisha ubumuntu.

src: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
tgt: Ibice by'umuco bishobora gutandukana bitewe n'imyaka, ubwoko, icyiciro, ahantu, na / cyangwa igitsina cy'abagize.

src: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
tgt: Imico ituma umuco runaka utandukana n'indi ishobora kuba iy'ururimi, iy'ubwiza, iy'idini, iy'ubutegetsi, iy'imibonano mpuzabitsina, iy'aho umuntu atuye, cyangwa izindi mpamvu zose uko ari ebyiri.

src: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
tgt: Abari mu bwoko runaka akenshi bagaragaza ko bari mu bwoko runaka binyuriye mu gukoresha imiterere itandukanye kandi y'ikigereranyo, irimo imyambaro, imyifatire n'imvugo.

src: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
tgt: Bumwe mu buryo bukunze gukoreshwa cyane mu kugaragaza akamaro ko kwifatanya n'abandi, ni ukugereranya ibihereranye n'abana bake b'abagiraneza batitaweho n'abantu bakuru mu gihe bari bakiri bato, bitewe n'uko babaga batitaweho, babaga bahitanywe n'impanuka, cyangwa se bakicwa n'abantu bakuru.

src: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
tgt: Hari abana bamwe na bamwe b'inkazi bafatwa n'abantu (ubusanzwe ni ababyeyi babo bwite); mu bihe bimwe na bimwe, iyo bana barekurwa bitewe n'uko ababyeyi babo banze ko umwana wabo aba afite ubumuga bukomeye bwo mu bwenge cyangwa mu mubiri.

src: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
tgt: Abana bo mu ishyamba bashobora kuba barigeze gukorerwa ihohoterwa rikomeye cyangwa bakagira ibikomere bikomeye mbere yo kurekurwa cyangwa guhunga.

src: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
tgt: Hari n'abandi bavuga ko barerewe n'inyamaswa; abandi bavuga ko babaga mu ishyamba bonyine.

src: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
tgt: Iyo umwana w'inyamaswa akuze mu buryo bwuzuye n'inyamaswa zitari abantu, agaragaza imyifatire (muri ibipimo by'umubiri) hafi ya yose nk'iy'iyo nyamaswa, urugero nko gutinya abantu cyangwa kutita ku bo.

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
tgt: Mu gihe kwiga hakoreshejwe porogaramu bikwiye gutuma kwiga byoroha kandi bikagushimisha kurushaho, uburyo bwo kwiga hakoreshejwe porogaramu bukora ibirenze ibyo.

src: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
tgt: Gushyira ibintu ku ntebe si uburyo bwo kwiga, ahubwo ni uburyo bwo gufasha abantu barimo kwiga ibintu bishya, urugero nko gukoresha porogaramu nshya ya orudinateri cyangwa gutangira gukora ikintu gishya.

src: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
tgt: Ibishushanyo bishobora kuba by'ukuri cyangwa by'ukuri, mu yandi magambo, umwarimu ni ubwoko bw'ibishushanyo ariko ni na ko bimeze ku muntu muto w'impapuro muri Microsoft Office.

src: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
tgt: Virtual Scaffolds zishyirwa muri porogaramu kandi zigamije kubaza ibibazo, gushimangira no gusobanura imikorere ishobora kuba yari imbogamizi ku munyeshuri kuyikora wenyine.

src: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
tgt: Abana bashyirwa mu bigo byita ku bana bitewe n'impamvu zitandukanye, urugero nk'ukwirengagiza, gukorerwa ihohoterwa, ndetse no guhatirwa.

src: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
tgt: Nta mwana n'umwe wagombye kurererwa ahantu hatagira uburere, aho abantu batita ku bandi, kandi aho batabigisha, ariko ni ko bimeze.

src: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
tgt: Turabona ko gahunda yo kurera abana mu rugo ari ahantu hatekanye kuri abo bana.

src: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
tgt: Ishyirahamwe ryacu ry'ababyeyi barera abana rifite intego yo kubaha amazu meza, ababarera bafite urukundo, amashuri meza, n'ubuvuzi buzira amakemwa.

src: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
tgt: Abashyingiranywe bagombye guhabwa ibintu byose by'ibanze babaga badafite mu rugo babamo mbere.

src: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
tgt: Muri interineti harimo uburyo bwo gushyikirana n'abantu benshi no gushyikirana n'abantu ku giti cyabo.

src: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
tgt: Imico itandukanye ya interineti ituma habaho indi mico mu bijyanye n'uburyo bwo kuyikoresha no kuyishimira.

src: For example, "learning" and "socialization" are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
tgt: Urugero, hari abavuga ko gukoresha interineti bigira uruhare rukomeye mu "kwigishwa" no "kwishyira hamwe n'abandi" (James n'abandi mu 1995).

src: "Personal involvement" and "continuing relationships" were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
tgt: Eighmey na McCord (1998) na bo bagaragaje ko "kwishyira mu bikorwa" no "gukomeza imishyikirano" ari ibintu bishya bitera abantu gushimisha abandi, ubwo bakoraga ubushakashatsi ku kuntu abarebera kuri interineti bakoresha.

src: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
tgt: Ikoreshwa ry'amashusho ya videwo ryatumye havumburwa ibintu by'ingenzi mu gusobanura imyitwarire ya mikoro, imyitwarire y'urusobe ibaho mu masegonda make.

src: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
tgt: By'umwihariko, bavuga ko umuntu ashobora kumenya niba umuntu abeshya binyuriye mu gusobanura neza imiterere y'uruhu.

src: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
tgt: Mu gitabo cye cyitwa The President's Speech, Oliver Sacks yagaragaje ukuntu abantu badashobora kumva ibyo bavuga bitewe n'uko ubwonko bwabo bwagize ikibazo, na bo bashobora kumenya neza niba umuntu ari umuntu w'inziraburyarya.

src: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
tgt: Ndetse avuga ko ubwo bushobozi bwo gusobanura imyifatire y'abantu bushobora no kumera nk'ubw'inyamaswa, urugero nk'imbwa zo mu rugo.

src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu kinyejana cya makumyabiri bwagaragaje ko hari ibigega bibiri by'imiterere itandukanye y'ibinyabuzima: icyihishe n'icyagaragara.

src: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
tgt: Guhindurwa kw'imiterere y'ibinyabuzima byongeraho imiterere mishya y'ibinyabuzima, kandi guhitamo bigakuraho imiterere mishya y'ibinyabuzima.

src: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
tgt: Gucamo ibice no kongera guhuza bihindura itandukaniro hagati y'ibice byombi mu gihe cy'igihe runaka.

src: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
tgt: Mu mashyamba, biragoye ko inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo muri rusange.

src: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
tgt: Byongeye kandi, kudakora ibyo bigira ingaruka zikomeye, ni ukuvuga gukura nabi, kubura ibyokurya, kandi amaherezo bikazana urupfu.

src: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
tgt: Ibinyabuzima by'ibimera byashoboraga kuboneka mu buryo bworoshye kurusha ubundi, byari kuba ibinyabuzima by'ibinyabuzima by'amababi n'ibinyampeke, ariko ibyo biragoye ko ibinyabuzima nk'ibyacu bibikora mu mubiri, keretse iyo byatwitswe.

src: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
tgt: Ku rundi ruhande, ibyokurya by'inyamaswa (ibimera, ibimera, amagi) ntibikora gusa ku mubiri mu buryo bworoshye, ahubwo birimo protini nyinshi cyane zifite amine acides zose z'ingenzi.

src: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
tgt: Mu by'ukuri, ntitwagombye gutangazwa n'uko ba sekuruza bacu bo mu gihe cya kera bashoboye gukemura "ikibazo cy'ibinyabutabire" mu buryo bumwe na bumwe nk'uko imbwa zo muri iki gihe zikora mu mashyamba.

src: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10-60 minutes).
tgt: Gucika intege mu gihe cyo gusinzira ni uburyo bwo guhaguruka mu gihe cyo gusinzira, maze ugasinzira nyuma y'iminota mike (10-60).

src: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
tgt: Ibyo bishobora gukorwa mu buryo bworoshye binyuriye mu gukoresha isaha y'umwimerere utabona, kugira ngo igusobanurire utarinze gukanguka.

src: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
tgt: Niba uryamye, ushobora gushyira isaha ku rundi ruhande rw'icyumba, bigatuma uhaguruka ku buriri kugira ngo uyizimye.

src: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
tgt: Ibindi bintu by'ingenzi umuntu yakora mbere yo kuryama, ni ukunywa amazi menshi (cyane cyane amazi cyangwa icyayi, ibizwi ko bifasha mu kuvura imyanda), bityo bigatuma umuntu ahaguruka kugira ngo asukure.

src: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one's body and spirit.
tgt: Uko umuntu aba afite amahoro yo mu mutima, ni ko aba afite n'imihangayiko yo mu mubiri no mu mutima.

src: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
tgt: Iyo umuntu adashishikajwe cyane n'ibintu, imbaraga z'ubuzima ziba ari nziza kurushaho.

src: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
