tgt: Umuntu wese ashobora kugera kuri iyo ntego. Ikintu cyonyine cyaturinda kugera kuri iyo ntego ni imihangayiko yacu bwite hamwe n'ibyiyumvo bibi.

src: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
tgt: Buddhisme ya Tibet ishingiye ku nyigisho za Buddha, ariko yakwirakwijwe n'inzira ya mahayana y'urukundo hamwe n'uburyo bwinshi bwa Yoga y'Abahindi.

src: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
tgt: Mu by'ukuri, idini ry'Ababuda bo muri Tibet riroroshye cyane.Ririmo Kundalini Yoga, gutekereza hamwe n'inzira y'urukundo rwagutse.

src: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
tgt: Muri Kundalini Yoga, imbaraga za Kundalini (imbaraga z'umucyo) zihaguruka binyuze mu myambaro ya yoga, imyitozo yo guhumeka, amasengesho no kwiyumvisha ibintu.

src: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
tgt: Ikigo cy'ibitekerezo bya Tibet ni Yoga y'Imana. Binyuze mu kwiyumvisha imana zitandukanye, inzira z'imbaraga zirasukuzwa, chakras zirakorwa kandi ubwenge bw'umucyo buratangwa.

src: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'Intambara ya Kabiri y'Isi Yose, u Budage bwari umwanzi wa Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Abasoviyeti na Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, ibyo bikaba byaratumye ibihugu byombi bifatanya.

src: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
tgt: Nyuma y'imyaka ibiri intambara irangiye, ibihugu byahoze bifatanyije byari byarahindutse abanzi, maze Intambara y'Amaguru itangira.

src: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
tgt: Ryari kuzabaho mu myaka 40 yakurikiyeho, kandi rwari kurwanywa mu buryo bw'ukuri, n'ingabo z'abantu, mu duce tw'intambara kuva muri Afurika kugeza muri Aziya, muri Afuganistani, muri Cuba no mu bindi bice byinshi.

src: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
tgt: Ku itariki ya 17 Nzeri 1939, ingabo z'Abapolonye zari zarasenyutse, kandi icyari kigomba gukorwa ni ukwirukanwa no kongera kwitegura ku nkombe y'inyanja yo mu Burumania.

src: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
tgt: Ariko kandi, iyo myigaragambyo yarabaye ubusa mu ijoro rimwe gusa, igihe abasirikare barenga 800.000 bo mu gisirikare cy'Umuryango w'Abasoviyeti cy'Umuryango w'Abasoviyeti binjiraga mu bihugu by'u Burusiya n'u Burusiya, nyuma yo gutera ibice byo mu burasirazuba bw'u Buyapani, ibyo bikaba byari binyuranyije n'amasezerano y'amahoro yo mu mugi wa Riga, n'amasezerano yo mu Burusiya n'u Buyapani yo kutagira intambara, hamwe n'andi masezerano mpuzamahanga, yaba ayo mu bihugu byombi cyangwa menshi.

src: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
tgt: Gukoresha amato mu gutwara ibintu, ni bwo buryo bwiza cyane bwo gutwara abantu benshi n'ibintu mu nyanja.

src: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
tgt: Umurimo w'abasirikare b'inyanja kuva kera ni ukugenzura ko igihugu cyawe gikomeza kugira ubushobozi bwo kwimura abantu n'ibintu byacyo, mu gihe mu gihe kimwe, kibuza umwanzi wawe ubushobozi bwo kwimura abantu be n'ibintu bye.

src: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
tgt: Kimwe mu byerekeranye n'ibyo cyabayeho mu gihe cy'Intambara ya Kabiri yo mu Burasirazuba bwa Atlantike, ubwo Abanyamerika bageragezaga kuvana abantu n'ibintu mu Nyanja ya Atlantike kugira ngo bafashe Ubwongereza.

src: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
tgt: Muri icyo gihe, ingabo z'Abadage zakoreshaga cyane cyane ubwato bwitwa U-boat, zari zirimo kugerageza guhagarika iyo ngendo.

src: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
tgt: Iyo ingabo z'Abanyaburayi n'iz'Abasoviyeti zitahagera, birashoboka ko Ubudage bwashoboraga gutsinda Ubwongereza nk'uko bwatsinze ibindi bihugu by'i Burayi.

src: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
tgt: Biboneka ko imbuzi zabanje kuribwa mu misozi ya Zagros yo muri Irani, hakaba hashize imyaka igera ku 10.000.

src: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
tgt: Abantu bo mu mico n'imiryango ya kera batangiye kubitunga kugira ngo babashe kubona amata, imisatsi, inyama n'ubwoya byoroshye.

src: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
tgt: Inzovu zo mu rugo zabaga zigizwe n'imiryango y'intama zabaga zigenderaga mu misozi cyangwa mu tundi turere tw'uburobyi, akenshi zikaba zari ziyobowe n'abashumba b'inzovu, abenshi bakaba bari abana cyangwa abakiri bato, nk'uko umwungeri wamenyekanye cyane abikora.

src: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
tgt: Mu Bwongereza, mu ntangiriro z'ikinyejana cya 16, hatangiye kubakwa imihanda y'amagare.

src: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
tgt: N'ubwo imihanda y'amagare yari igizwe gusa n'ibiti by'ibiti byagereranywaga, yatumaga amafarashi yahagurukaga yihuta cyane kandi agakura imitwaro myinshi kurusha uko byari bimeze mu mihanda y'icyo gihe yari ifite ibisazi.

src: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
tgt: Icyakora, buhoro buhoro, byaje kugaragara ko izo nzira zari gukoreshwa neza kurushaho iyo zigizwe n'igishushanyo cy'icyuma hejuru.

src: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
tgt: Ibyo byatangiye gukoreshwa cyane, ariko ibyuma byatumaga amagare y'ibiti y'iyo mikogote arushaho kurakara.

src: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
tgt: Amaherezo, amagare y'ibiti yasimbuwe amagare y'icyuma, maze mu mwaka wa 1767, haboneka imihanda ya mbere y'icyuma.

src: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
tgt: Mu myaka miriyoni ebyiri ishize, abantu batangiye kugenda bahagaze, ubwo habonekaga Homo Erectus (bisobanurwa ko ari umuntu uhagaze).

src: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
tgt: Abakurambere babo, ari bo Australopithecus, ntibashoboraga kugenda bahagaze nk'uko byari bisanzwe.

src: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
tgt: Ibisigazwa by'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa Australopithecus byavumbuwe mu myaka miriyoni 4.2-3.9 ishize, bigaragaza ko inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa Sahelanthropus zari zifite ibirenge bibiri, nubwo bishobora kuba ko zatangiye kugenda ku birenge bibiri mu myaka miriyoni irindwi ishize.

src: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
tgt: Dushobora gutangira kubaho mu buryo butagirira nabi ibidukikije, dushobora kwifatanya n'itsinda ryita ku bidukikije, ndetse dushobora no kuba abanyamuryango kugira ngo dufashe kugabanya mu rugero runaka imibabaro izaba mu gihe kizaza.

src: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
tgt: Icyakora, niba tutashaka umuti w'igihe gito gusa, twagombye kumenya inkomoko y'ibibazo, maze tukabihagarika.

src: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
tgt: Biragaragara neza ko isi yahindutse cyane bitewe n'amajyambere y'abantu mu bya siyansi no mu bya tekiniki, kandi ko ibibazo byarushijeho kwiyongera bitewe n'ubwiyongere bw'abaturage n'imyifatire y'abantu y'ubwibone.

src: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
tgt: Nyuma yo kwemezwa n'Inteko Ishinga Amategeko ku itariki ya 4 Nyakanga, inyandiko yanditswe n'intoki yashyizweho umukono na Perezida w'Inteko Ishinga Amategeko John Hancock n'Umunyamabanga Charles Thomson, yoherejwe mu cyumba cy'ubuhinduzi cya John Dunlap cyari kure y'aho.

src: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides."
tgt: Mu ijoro ry'uwo munsi, kopi zigera kuri 150 kugeza kuri 200 z'icyo gitabo, ubu zikaba zizwi nka "Dunlap broadsides".

src: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
tgt: Urwandiko rwa mbere rwasomwe ku mugaragaro na John Nixon mu rugo rwa Independence Hall ku itariki ya 8 Nyakanga.

src: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
tgt: Ku itariki ya 6 Nyakanga, imwe yoherejwe George Washington wayisomye ku ngabo ze zari muri New York ku itariki ya 9 Nyakanga.

src: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
tgt: Ibice 25 by'iyo nyandiko bya Dunlap bikiriho, ni byo kopi za kera cyane z'iyo nyandiko zisigaye.

src: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
tgt: Muri iki gihe, abenshi mu bahanga mu by'ibinyabuzima bya kera bemera ko hari itsinda ry'ibinyabuzima bya kera byagiye bibaho kandi ko n'ubu bikiriho.

src: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
tgt: Abantu benshi ntibabitekerezaho ko ari inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa dinosaurs kubera ko zifite amababa kandi ko zishobora kuruka.

src: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
tgt: Ariko hari ibintu byinshi by'inyoni bikomeje kumera nk'ibya dinosaure.

src: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
tgt: Bafite ibirenge bifite ibipfunsi n'amaboko, batera amagi, kandi bagendera ku birenge byabo bibiri by'inyuma nka T-Rex (T-Rex).

src: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
tgt: Kimwe na za orudinateri zose zikoreshwa muri iki gihe, zishingiye ku gukoresha amakuru yanditswe mu buryo bw'imibare ya binary.

src: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
tgt: Inkomoko ya binary ishobora kuba ifite agaciro kamwe gusa muri abiri, ni ukuvuga 0 cyangwa 1, kandi izo nomero zitwa binary digits - cyangwa bits, dukoresheje imvugo ya ordinateri.

src: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
tgt: Ibimenyetso by'iyo ndwara, urugero nko kuruka, usanga ari byinshi ku buryo umuntu adashobora kumenya ko ari ndwara.

src: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
tgt: Icya mbere gishobora kugaragaza ko umuntu afite uburozi bwo mu mubiri, ni ukuba afite igikombe cy'imiti cyangwa ibindi bikoresho byo mu rugo by'uburozi.

src: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
tgt: Jya usuzuma ibicuruzwa byanditseho kugira ngo umenye amabwiriza ajyanye n'ibyo wakora kugira ngo wirinde uwo mutsi.

src: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
tgt: Abahanga mu by'inzige bakoresha ijambo "inzige" mu buryo bwemewe ku birebana n'iri tsinda ry'udukoko.

src: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
tgt: Iyo mvugo ituruka ku byo abantu bo mu gihe cya kera bari baziho, ni ukuvuga udukoko twitwa bed-bugs, tubasha kwanduza abantu.

src: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
tgt: Ibicurane byitwa Assassin na Bed-bugs byombi ni ibishyimbo, bikunda kuba mu bishyimbo cyangwa mu nzu y'umuntu wabyibamo.

src: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
tgt: Muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika hose, hari abantu bagera kuri 400.000 bazize indwara ya sclérose en plaques (MS), bityo ikaba ari yo ndwara y'ubwonko ihitana abantu bakuru bakiri bato n'abageze mu za bukuru.

src: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
tgt: MS ni indwara ifata imyanya y'ubwonko, ikaba igizwe n'ubwonko, uruhu rw'umugongo n'uruhu rwo mu maso.

src: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko abagore bafite ibyago byo kurwara indwara ya MS incuro ebyiri kurusha abagabo.

src: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
tgt: Umugabo n'umugore bashobora gufata umwanzuro w'uko kurera umwana atari byo byaba byiza kuri bo cyangwa ku mwana.

src: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
tgt: Abo bashakanye bashobora guhitamo kurera umwana wabo mu buryo bwemewe n'amategeko.

src: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
tgt: Mu gihe cyo kurera umwana, ababyeyi b'ukuri bareka uburenganzira bwabo bw'ababyeyi kugira ngo undi mugabo n'umugore bashobore kurera uwo mwana.

src: Science's main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
tgt: Intego y'ibanze y'abahanga mu bya siyansi ni ukumenya uko isi ikora binyuriye ku buryo bwo gukora ubushakashatsi bw'abahanga.

src: It isn't alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
tgt: Icyakora, ntabwo ari yo yonyine, igerageza, kandi igerageza ni igerageza rikoreshwa mu gukuraho kimwe cyangwa byinshi mu byagereranywa bishobora kubaho, bibaza ibibazo, kandi no gukora ubushakashatsi bw'ubumenyi na byo bigaragariza ubushakashatsi.

src: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
tgt: Abahanga mu by'ibinyabuzima n'abahanga mu bya filozofiya bashingiraga ibitekerezo byabo ku nyandiko za kera, cyane cyane kuri Bibiliya yo mu kilatini.

src: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
tgt: Abantu benshi bemeraga ibitekerezo bya Aristote ku birebana n'ibintu byose birebana na siyansi, hakubiyemo n'ubumenyi bw'imitekerereze.

src: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
tgt: Uko ubumenyi bw'Ikigiriki bwagendaga bugabanuka, ibihugu byo mu Burengerazuba byabonye ko bitandukanyijwe n'imitangire ya filozofiya n'ubuhanga bya Kigiriki.

src: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
tgt: Imikorere myinshi y'umubiri n'imyitwarire y'abantu usanga ahanini bishingiye ku mibereho y'umubiri n'uko ikorwa n'amasaha y'umubiri.

src: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
tgt: Ibinyabuzima byinshi, harimo n'ibinyabutabire, ibimera n'inyamaswa, birangwa n'imikorere idashingiye ku bintu by'inyuma gusa.

src: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
tgt: Amasaha y'ibinyabuzima ni ibinyabuzima byigenzura ubwabyo bikomeza igihe cy'urugendo rw'ibinyabuzima n'iyo nta bimenyetso byo hanze bihari.

src: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi bwa Hershey na Chase ni bumwe mu bushakashatsi bwa mbere bwagaragaje ko ADN ari ikintu cy'ibinyabuzima.

src: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
tgt: Hershey na Chase bakoresheje virusi zo mu bwoko bwa phage kugira ngo bashyire ADN yabo mu bwoko bw'ibicurane (bacterium).

src: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
tgt: Bakoze ibigeragezo bibiri byerekana ADN iri muri phage ikoresheje phosphorus cyangwa protini yo muri phage ikoresheje sulfur ikoresha radiyo.

src: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
tgt: Ibibazo by'ihindagurika ry'imiterere y'umubiri bishobora kugira ingaruka zitandukanye bitewe n'ubwoko bw'ihindagurika ry'imiterere y'umubiri, agaciro k'igice cy'imiterere y'umubiri cyahindutse ndetse n'uko uturemangingo twanduye ari uturemangingo two mu bwoko bwa germinal.

src: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
tgt: Ibinyabuzima byahindutse mu buryo bw'umubiri ni byo byonyine byashoboraga kuvukira ku bana, mu gihe ibinyabuzima byahindutse mu buryo bw'umubiri ibindi bishobora guteza uburwayi bwa kanseri cyangwa urupfu.

src: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
tgt: Ubukerarugendo bushingiye ku bidukikije butuma abantu bashishikazwa no gusura uturere tw'ibinyabuzima kugira ngo baryoherwe n'imiterere yaho, harimo n'ibimera n'inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba.

src: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
tgt: Urugero rw'ibyo umuntu yakora muri ako gace ni ukurya, kuroba, gufata amafoto, kureba inyoni, gusura pariki no kwiga amakuru ajyanye n'imiterere y'ibidukikije.

src: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
tgt: Urugero, ni ugusura, gufata amafoto, no kwiga ibyerekeye organgatuangs zo mu kirwa cya Borneo.

src: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
tgt: Buri gitondo, abantu bava mu midugudu y'icyaro bajya ku kazi mu modoka, maze bakagenderwa n'abandi bantu bajya ku kazi aho bari bavuye.

src: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
tgt: Muri iyi modoka y'imodoka, buri muntu wese afitanye isano n'imodoka z'abantu, kandi aba ashyigikiye iyo modoka.

src: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
tgt: Ubu abahanga mu bya siyansi bagaragaza ko ubwo bucuruzi bukomeye bw'amabuye y'agaciro ya karuboni bwatumye ikirere cy'ibinyabuzima kigira imimerere idahwitse, iyo ikaba ari yo yatumye abantu bahinduka mu myaka miriyoni ebyiri ishize.

src: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
tgt: Buri wese agira uruhare mu iterambere ry'umuryango kandi akoresha uburyo bwo gutwara abantu n'ibintu.

src: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
tgt: Mu bihugu byateye imbere, ni gake wumva abantu bavuga ibintu nk'ibyo ku birebana n'ubwiza bw'amazi cyangwa ku birebana no kugwa kw'ibiraro.

src: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
tgt: Kuki abahanga mu bijyanye n'imikoreshereze y'ibinyabiziga baterwa impungenge, kandi se ni iki gituma buri munsi bica intege?

src: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
tgt: Ikigenda cy'imodoka ni ubushakashatsi ku mihanda y'abagenzi n'imodoka hagati y'ibice bibiri n'imishyikirano bagirana hagati yabo.

src: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
tgt: Ikibabaje ni uko kwiga ibijyanye n'imikorere y'imodoka bigoye kubera ko umuntu adashobora kumenya neza uko umushoferi azaba ameze.

src: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
tgt: Igishimishije ni uko abashoferi bakunze kugira imyitwarire idashidikanywaho; ku bw'ibyo, imihanda ikunda kugira imyitwarire idashidikanywaho kandi ishobora kugereranywa mu buryo bw'ibaruramari.

src: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
tgt: Kugira ngo abantu basobanukirwe neza uko imodoka zikurikirana, bashyize hamwe ibintu bitatu by'ingenzi: (1) uko imodoka zikurikirana, (2) umubare wa modoka zikurikirana, na (3) umuvuduko.

src: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
tgt: Iyo mibanire ifasha mu gutegura, mu gukora no mu gukoresha imihanda.

src: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
tgt: Kubera ko inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inyamaswa.

src: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
tgt: Inzige nyinshi zifite igikundiro cyo kuba zifite ubushobozi bwo gukubita amababa yazo zigana inyuma mu mubiri.

src: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
tgt: Ibyo bituma bagira ahantu heza cyane ho kwihisha ibisiga.

src: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
tgt: Muri iki gihe, inyenyeri zonyine zidashobora gukubita amababa yazo inyuma, ni izitwa dragon flies na mayflies.

src: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
tgt: Mu myaka ibarirwa mu bihumbi ishize, umugabo witwaga Arisitariko yavuze ko isanzure ry'izuba rikikije izuba.

src: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
tgt: Abantu bamwe batekerezaga ko ibyo yavuze ari ukuri, ariko abenshi bemeraga ibinyuranye n'ibyo; ko isanzure ry'izuba rikikije isi, harimo n'izuba (n'izindi nyenyeri).

src: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
tgt: Ibyo bisa n'ibihuje n'ubwenge, kubera ko Isi itumva nk'aho igenda, si byo?

src: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
tgt: Uruzi Amazone ni rwo rwa kabiri mu rwagati kandi ni na rwo runini cyane ku isi. Urwo ruzi rufite amazi asaga incuro 8 uruzi rwa kabiri runini.

src: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
tgt: Amazone na yo ni wo mugezi munini kurusha indi ku isi, rimwe na rimwe ukaba ufite uburebure bw'ibilometero bitandatu.

src: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
tgt: Amazi agera kuri 20 ku ijana y'amazi ava mu nzizi z'isi ajya mu nyanja, ava muri Amazon.

src: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
tgt: Umugezi mukuru wa Amazone ufite uburebure bw'ibirometero 6.387 kandi ujyana amazi ava mu migezi mike ibarirwa mu bihumbi.

src: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
tgt: Nubwo imirimo yo kubaka za piramide z'amabuye yakomeje kugeza ku iherezo ry'Ubwami bw'Ikirenga, za piramide zo i Gizeh ntizazigera zirenga izindi mu bunene bwazo no mu buryo bw'ikoranabuhanga bwo kuzubaka.

src: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
tgt: Abanyamisiri ba kera batangazwaga n'inyubako zo kwibutsa zabayeho mbere yabo, zari zaramaze imyaka irenga igihumbi.

src: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
tgt: Umujyi wa Vatikani ufite abaturage bagera kuri 800. Ni cyo gihugu gito cyane ku isi gifite ubwigenge kandi ni cyo gifite abaturage bake cyane.

src: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
tgt: Umujyi wa Vatikani ukoresha ururimi rw'Igifaransa mu mategeko yawo no mu itangazamakuru.

src: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
tgt: Icyitaliyani na cyo ni ururimi rukoreshwa buri munsi n'abakozi benshi bo muri leta, mu gihe Ikilatini akenshi gikoreshwa mu birori by'idini.

src: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
tgt: Abaturage bose bo mu Mujyi wa Vatikani ni Abagatolika b'Abaroma.

src: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
tgt: Abantu bamenye iby'ibinyabuzima by'ibanze nk'izahabu, ifeza n'umujumpu kuva kera, kubera ko ibyo byose bishobora kuboneka mu bidukikije mu buryo bwabyo bwite kandi bikaba byoroshye kubikubura hakoreshejwe ibikoresho bya kera.

src: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
tgt: Umuhanga mu bya filozofiya witwaga Aristote, yavuze ko ibintu byose byatunganijwe n'ikintu kimwe cyangwa byinshi mu bintu bine by'ingenzi, ari byo isi, amazi, umwuka n'umuriro.

src: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
tgt: Ibyo byasaga n'imimerere ine y'ibinyabuzima (mu buryo bumwe): icyuma, icyuma, ikirere, n'umuvuduko w'amaraso, n'ubwo na we yavugaga ko ibyo bihinduka ibintu bishya kugira ngo bitange ibyo tubona.

src: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
tgt: Mu by'ukuri, ibyuma by'ubwoko bumwe ni umwimerere w'ibyuma bibiri cyangwa birenga.

src: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
tgt: Ibinyabuzima nka kalisiyumu na potasiyumu bifatwa ko ari ibyuma, ariko nanone hari ibyuma nka feza na zahabu.

src: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
tgt: Hari n'ibikomoka ku bintu bitagizwe n'icyuma, urugero nk'ikaruboni.

src: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
tgt: Ikintu cyose kiri mu isanzure ry'ikirere kigizwe n'ibinyabuzima byitwa atome.

src: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
tgt: Atomu ni nto cyane ku buryo za miriyari n'imiliyari z'izo atomu zishobora kwinjiza mu kigero kiri ku iherezo ry'aya magambo.

src: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
tgt: Ku bw'ibyo rero, igihe icyuma cyatangiraga gukoreshwa, abantu benshi bagikoreshaga neza.

src: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
tgt: Ikibabaje ni uko uko uburyo bushya bwo kwandika bwashyizwe mu bikorwa, icyuma cy'umuhondo cyagiye gifatwa nk'ikintu cy'ibanze kandi kigakoreshwa mu buryo bworoheje.

src: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
tgt: Ubu abantu bandika ubutumwa kuri orudinateri, nta na rimwe bakenera kujya hafi y'ibikoresho byo gucapa.

src: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
tgt: Umuntu ashobora kwibaza gusa icyo keyboard izaba nk'iki igihe hazabaho ikindi kintu gishya.

src: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
tgt: Ibikoresho by'ibisasu byitwa fission bomb bikora hakurikijwe ingingo ngenderwaho ivuga ko hakenerwa imbaraga kugira ngo nucleus ifite protons na neutrons nyinshi ishyirwe hamwe.

src: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
tgt: Ibyo ni nk'aho ujya gukubita igare riremereye ugana ku musozi, maze ukongera gukabura uruhu rwayo, maze ukagorora imbaraga zimwe na zimwe.

src: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
tgt: Atomu zimwe na zimwe zifite inyenyeri zidakora neza, ibyo bikaba bisobanura ko zigira imyifatire yo gutandukana nta kintu kinini cyangwa nta kintu na kimwe cyaziguha.

src: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
tgt: Icyerekezo cy'ukwezi kigizwe n'amabuye n'umukungugu, kandi igice cyo hanze cyacyo kizwi nka crust.

src: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
tgt: Iki gice gifite uburebure bw'ibirometero 70 ku ruhande rw'imbere n'uburebure bw'ibirometero 100 ku ruhande rw'imbere.

src: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
tgt: Iyo iri munsi y'inyanja y'inyanja y'inyanja, iba ntoya ariko iyo iri munsi y'imisozi iba ndende.

src: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
tgt: Ku ruhande rw'inyanja y'Iburasirazuba hashobora kuba hari amazi menshi cyane, bitewe n'uko ikirere cy'inyanja ari gito, bityo bikaba byoroshye ko imvura y'igisebo igwa hejuru.

src: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
tgt: Ibyo abantu batekereza ku birebana n'ibikubiye muri Bibiliya, usanga bishingiye ku gushaka kumenya icyo gituma abantu baryoherwa.

src: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
tgt: Izi nyigisho zigaragaza ko abantu bafite ibyo bakeneye n'ibyifuzo bimwe na bimwe byinjijwe mu mutima wabo uko bakura bagera mu bukuru.

src: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
tgt: Izo nyigisho zishingiye ku bintu bituma abantu bamwe na bamwe bifuza gukora ibintu runaka, no ku bintu biri mu mibereho yabo bishobora gutuma bakora ibintu runaka cyangwa bakabyirinda.

src: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
tgt: Inzobere ebyiri zikunzwe cyane z'ibikenewe ni iz'i Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory na Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain "one of the guys" (or gals).
tgt: Muri rusange, imyitwarire ibiri ishobora kugaragara igihe abayobozi batangira kuyobora abo bari basanzwe ari inshuti.

src: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
tgt: Aba bayobozi nk'abo usanga bibagora gufata imyanzuro idakundwa n'abantu, gufata ingamba zo kubahana, gusuzuma ibyo bakora, guha abantu inshingano no kubabaza ibyo bakora.

src: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
tgt: Ku rundi ruhande, umuntu ahinduka nk'umuntu utazwi wiyumvisha ko agomba guhindura ibintu byose uwo muryango wakoraga maze akabikora ku bwe.

src: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
tgt: N'ubundi kandi, umuyobozi ni we ugenzura ko itsinda rigira icyo rigeraho cyangwa rigatsindwa.

src: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
tgt: Akenshi iyo myifatire ituma abayobozi batandukana n'abandi bagize itsinda.

src: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
tgt: Amatsinda ya mudasobwa agenderwaho n'amahame nk'aya amatsinda asanzwe, ariko hari ibintu bitandukanye.

src: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
tgt: Abagize itsinda ryo mu buryo bw'ikigereranyo akenshi bakora nk'aho ari bo bahurira n'itsinda ryabo ryo mu buryo bw'umubiri.

src: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
tgt: Akenshi usanga bafite ubwigenge burenze ubw'abari mu matsinda asanzwe kuko amatsinda yabo ashobora guhura hakurikijwe imiterere itandukanye y'amasaha ishobora kutamenyekana n'abayobozi babo bo mu karere.

src: The presence of a true "invisible team" (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
tgt: Kuba hari "itsinda ritaboneka" ry'ukuri (Larson na LaFasto, 1989, ipaji ya 109) na byo ni kimwe mu bice by'ingenzi by'itsinda ry'ukuri.

src: The "invisible team" is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
tgt: "Ikipe itaboneka" ni itsinda ry'abayobozi, buri wese mu bagize iryo tsinda akaba ashyikirizwa raporo.

src: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
tgt: Kuki ishyirahamwe ry'ubucuruzi ryifuza kujya mu nzira itwara igihe yo gushyiraho ishyirahamwe ry'ubumenyi? Intego imwe yo gushyira mu bikorwa ibitekerezo by'ubumenyi bw'ubucuruzi ni ubuvanganzo.

src: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
tgt: Iyo ibikoresho byose bihari bikoreshejwe neza mu nzego zose z'ishyirahamwe, ubumenyingiro n'ubushakashatsi bishobora kugaragara.

src: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
tgt: Ku bw'ibyo, gahunda y'ishyirahamwe rikorana kugira ngo ribashe gutsinda inzitizi ishobora gutuma hashyirwaho uburyo bushya bushya bwo gufasha abakiriya.

src: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
tgt: Mbere y'uko ishyirahamwe rishobora guhanga ibintu bishya, ubuyobozi bugomba kurema umuco wo guhanga ibintu bishya ndetse no gusangira ubumenyi n'imyitozo y'ishirahamwe.

src: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
tgt: Angel (2006), asobanura uburyo bwa Continuum nk'uburyo bukoreshwa mu gufasha amashyirahamwe kugera ku rwego rwo hejuru rw'ibikorwa.

src: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
tgt: Ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi bw'imikorere y'ubwonko (neurobiology) byerekana uburyo bwo gukora ubushakashatsi ku bwenge.

src: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
tgt: Ubufatanye buri hagati y'uburwayi bw'ubwonko n'imyitwarire bushyigikira abahanga mu bushakashatsi bwabo.

src: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
tgt: Bamaze igihe kirekire bazi ko ubwoko butandukanye bw'ibikomere by'ubwonko, ibikomere, ibikomere, n'ibikomere bigira ingaruka ku myifatire kandi bigatera impinduka mu mirimo imwe n'imwe yo mu mutwe.

src: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
tgt: Ikwirakwira ry'ikoranabuhanga rishya rituma dushobora kubona no gusuzuma imiterere y'ubwonko n'imikorere yabwo tutari bwigeze tubona.

src: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
tgt: Ibyo bituronsa amakuru menshi n'ibikoresho byo kubaka imiterere y'ibipimo bidufasha gusobanukirwa imikorere yo mu bwenge bwacu.

src: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
tgt: N'ubwo ubuhanga mu by'ikoranabuhanga buzwi cyane nk'ubwisanzure mu bya siyansi, ubuhanga mu by'ikoranabuhanga ni ishami ry'ingenzi cyane mu bya siyansi y'ikoranabuhanga, rikora ku myitwarire, kwiga no kwiyoroshya mu mashini.

src: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
tgt: Ubushakashatsi ku birebana n'ubumenyi bw'ikoranabuhanga bugamije gukora imashini zikorera ku giti cyazo imirimo isaba ubwenge.

src: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
tgt: Ingero zirimo gucunga, gutegura no gushyira gahunda, ubushobozi bwo gusubiza ibibazo by'abakiliya, hamwe no kumenya inyandiko, ijwi n'ikimenyetso.

src: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
tgt: Ibyo bintu byahindutse inyigisho zinyuranye, zishingiye ku gutanga umuti w'ibibazo by'ukuri byo mu mibereho.

src: The AI system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
tgt: Ubu buryo bwa AI bukunze gukoreshwa mu by'ubukungu, mu buvuzi, mu buhinzi no mu gisirikare, nk'uko bwubatswe mu bikoresho bitandukanye by'ikoranabuhanga byo mu rugo no mu mikino ya videwo.

src: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
tgt: Akenshi umwarimu akunda kujyana abanyeshuri mu duce tudashobora kujyanwa na bisi.

src: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
tgt: Muri iki gihe, abanyeshuri bashobora gusura ibigega by'ibinyabuzima, bagasura ibigega by'ibinyabuzima byo mu mazi, cyangwa bagasura ibishushanyo by'ibinyabuzima byiza cyane, bakicara hamwe n'abanyeshuri babo.

src: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
tgt: Gushyira hamwe mu rugendo rwo kubwiriza na byo ni uburyo bwiza bwo gutekereza ku rugendo rwabo no gusangira ibyo babonye n'abanyeshuri bo mu gihe kizaza.

src: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
tgt: Urugero, buri mwaka abanyeshuri bo mu Ishuri rya Bennet ryo muri Karolina y'Amajyaruguru bashyiraho urubuga rwa interineti rwerekana urugendo bagiriye mu murwa mukuru w'icyo gihugu, buri mwaka urubuga rwa interineti ruvugururwa, ariko inyandiko za kera zikaba zisigaye ku rubuga nk'igitabo cy'amagambo.

src: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
tgt: Nubwo abanyeshuri bakunda gutangira kwandika ku mbuga nkoranyambaga bakoresheje indangagaciro z'ururimi n'indangagaciro z'indangagaciro, kuba hari ababyumva akenshi bihindura ibyo.

src: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
tgt: Kubera ko abanyeshuri ari bo bakunda gusesagura cyane, umwanditsi w'ibitabo atangira kwihatira kurushaho kwandika kugira ngo yirinde gusesagurwa.

src: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
tgt: Nanone kandi, gushyira ibintu ku mbuga nkoranyambaga "bihatira abanyeshuri kurushaho kumenya ibibera mu isi".

src: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
tgt: Kwandika ku mbuga nkoranyambaga ni igikoresho gitera inkunga y'ubufatanye, kandi gitera inkunga abanyeshuri gukomeza kwiga no hanze y'igihe cy'ishuri.

src: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
tgt: Gukoresha ibinyamakuru mu buryo bukwiriye "bishobora gufasha abanyeshuri kurushaho gusesengura no gushimangira; binyuze mu gusubiza ibitabo byo kuri interineti, abanyeshuri bashobora gusobanura imyumvire yabo mu nyandiko z'abandi ndetse no gusobanura ibitekerezo byabo ku bibazo runaka (Oravec, 2002).

src: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
tgt: Ottawa ni umurwa mukuru w'igihugu cya Kanada, ukaba ari umujyi mwiza cyane, aho abantu bavuga indimi ebyiri, kandi ukaba ugizwe n'amazu y'ububiko n'amazu y'ibikoresho by'ububiko bigaragaza amateka y'igihugu cya Canada.

src: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
tgt: Hagati mu majyepfo hari ibigega bya Niagara Falls, naho mu majyaruguru hakaba hari ubwiza bw'ibidukikije bw'umugezi wa Muskoka ndetse n'ubundi.

src: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
tgt: Ibyo byose hamwe n'ibindi, bigaragaza ko abaturutse hanze babona Ontario nk'aho ari cyo gihugu cy'u Kanade.

src: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
tgt: Mu turere twinshi two mu majyaruguru, nta bantu benshi babaho, kandi uturere tumwe na tumwe ni nk'umwimerere w'ubutayu.

src: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
tgt: Ku birebana n'umubare w'abaturage, hari ikintu gitangaza benshi: muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika hari Abanyamerika b'Abanyafurika benshi kurusha abanyarwanda.

src: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
tgt: Ibihugu by'Afurika y'Iburasirazuba biri mu Nyanja ya Hindi, hafi y'inyanja yo mu burasirazuba bwa Afurika.

src: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
tgt: Igihugu cya Madagasikari ni cyo gihambaye kurusha ibindi, kandi mu birebana n'ibinyabuzima byo mu ishyamba, ni cyo gihuriye ku mugabane.

src: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
tgt: Benshi mu birwa binini ni ibihugu byigenga, cyangwa bikaba bifitanye isano n'u Bufaransa, kandi bizwiho kuba ahantu heza ho kuruhukira ku nkombe z'ikiyaga.

src: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
tgt: Abarabu na bo bazanye idini ry'Abisilamu muri icyo gihugu, kandi ryagwiriye cyane mu birwa bya Comores na Mayotte.

src: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
tgt: Umupotogisi witwa Vasco da Gama yavumbuye umuhanda uva i Burayi ugana mu Buhindi, maze mu kinyejana cya 15 ab'i Burayi batangira kumukurikira.

src: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
tgt: Mu majyaruguru, ako karere gahana imbibi n'ikiyaga cya Sahel, mu majyepfo no mu burengerazuba na ho gahana imbibi n'inyanja ya Atlantike.

src: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
tgt: Abagore: Abagore bose bazajya mu rugendo bagirwa inama yo kuvuga ko bashyingiranywe, batitaye ku byo baba barashakanye koko.

src: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
tgt: Nanone kandi, ni byiza kwambara inkweto (ariko ntimujye mwambara isa n'iy'igiciro kinini cyane.

src: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
tgt: Abagore bagombye kumenya ko imico itandukanye ishobora gutuma babona ko ari ugukorerwa ihohoterwa, kandi ko ari ibisanzwe ko bagakurikirwa, bakakubitwa ukuboko, n'ibindi.

src: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
tgt: Jya wihangana mu kwanga abagabo, kandi ntutinye guhagarara ku ruhande rwawe (gutandukana mu mico cyangwa kutandukana, ntibituma ibintu biba byiza!).

src: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
tgt: Umujyi wa Casablanca wo muri iki gihe watangijwe n'abarobyi b'Abarabu mu kinyejana cya 10 M.I.C., kandi warakoreshwaga n'Abafenisiya, Abaroma n'Abamereni, nk'umujyi w'inkongi witwaga Anfa.

src: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
tgt: Abaporutugali barayirimbuye maze barayubaka bashyiraho izina rya Casa Branca, ariko nyuma y'umutingito wo mu mwaka wa 1755 barayiretse.

src: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
tgt: Sultan w'u Maroc yongeye kubaka umujyi witwa Daru l-Badya kandi watangajwe izina rya Casablanca n'abacuruzi b'Abanyespanye bashyizeho ibigo by'ubucuruzi aho.

src: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
tgt: Casablanca ni imwe mu mijyi yo muri Maroc yose itishimisha abantu cyane.

src: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
tgt: Mu bice byikikije Medina ya kera, biroroshye kubona aho bagurisha ibintu by'imigenzo ya Maroc, nk'ibikoresho by'ibumba, ibishyimbo, ibishyimbo, n'ibishyimbo by'ubwoko bwose, ariko byose ni iby'abashyitsi.

src: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
tgt: Goma ni umujyi w'ubukerarugendo wa Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Congo uri mu burasirazuba bukabije hafi y'u Rwanda .

src: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town's streets, particularly the town centre.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 2002, Goma yarasenywe n'umusenyi w'umusozi wa Nyiragongo watwikiye imihanda myinshi y'umujyi, cyane cyane hagati mu mujyi.

src: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
tgt: N'ubwo Goma ari ahantu hatekanye, umuntu wese ujya hanze ya Goma yagombye gukora ubushakashatsi kugira ngo amenye uko intambara ikomeje mu ntara ya Kivu y'Amajyaruguru.

src: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
tgt: Uyu mujyi ni na wo ufasha abantu kwambuka ikirunga cya Nyiragongo ndetse n'abagendera mu misozi y'i Nyiragongo bagakurikira inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa gorilla zo mu misozi zigurisha amafaranga make muri Afurika.

src: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
tgt: Ushobora gukoresha boda-boda (taxi y'imodoka) kugira ngo ugere i Goma. Igiciro rusange (mu karere) ni Frw 500 z'u Rwanda ku rugendo rurerure.

src: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
tgt: Kubera ko "Timbuktu" ari umujyi udashobora kugeraho, yagiye ikoreshwa mu buryo bw'ikigereranyo mu kuvuga ibihugu bitangaje kandi biri kure cyane.

src: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
tgt: Muri iki gihe, Timbuktu ni umujyi w'abakene, n'ubwo izina ryayo ryatumye abantu benshi bayikunda, kandi ifite n'ikibuga cy'indege.

src: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
tgt: Mu mwaka wa 1990, byongejwe ku rutonde rw'ibice by'ibinyabuzima by'isi biri mu kaga, bitewe n'akaga k'umusenyi w'ubutayu.

src: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
tgt: Ni kimwe mu bice by'ingenzi byahagaritswe mu gihe cya Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World .

src: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
tgt: Uwo mugi uratandukanye cyane n'indi mijyi yo muri icyo gihugu, bitewe n'uko ufite umuco w'Abarabu kurusha uwo muri Afrika.

src: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
tgt: Pariki y'Igihugu ya Kruger (KNP) iri mu majyaruguru ashyira uburasirazuba bw'Afurika y'Epfo kandi ijyana ku mupaka wa Mozambique mu burasirazuba, Zimbabwe mu majyaruguru, kandi umupaka wo mu majyepfo ni umugezi wa Crocodile.

src: The park covers 19,500 km2 and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
tgt: Iyo pariki ifite ubuso bwa kilometero kare 19,500 kandi igizwe n'ibice 14 bitandukanye by'ibinyabuzima, buri kimwe kigira inyamaswa zitandukanye.

src: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
tgt: Ni imwe mu nyubako z'ibanze zo muri Afurika y'Epfo kandi yitabwaho cyane n'Akarere ka Afurika y'Epfo (SANParks).

src: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
tgt: Nk'uko bimeze ku mashyamba yose yo muri Afurika y'Epfo, hari imisoro ya buri munsi yo kubungabunga no kwinjira muri iyo pariki.

src: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
tgt: Birashobora kandi kuba ingirakamaro ko umuntu agura Wild Card, itanga uburenganzira bwo kwinjira mu mashyamba ya Afurika y'Epfo cyangwa mu mashyamba yose yo muri Afurika y'Epfo.

src: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
tgt: Ikiyaga cya Hong Kong ni cyo gitanga izina ry'akarere ka Hong Kong, kandi ni na cyo abakerarugendo benshi babona ko ari cyo cy'ibanze.

src: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
tgt: Imirongo y'inyubako zo mu mujyi wa Hong Kong yagereranywa n'igishushanyo kigaragaza imiterere y'inyanja ya Victoria Harbour.

src: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
tgt: Kugira ngo urebe Hong Kong mu buryo bwiza cyane, ujye uvuye kuri icyo kirwa ujya ku kiyaga cya Kowloon giherereye hafi y'aho.

src: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
tgt: Igice kinini cy'umujyi wo ku kirwa cya Hong Kong giherereye ku nkombe yo mu majyaruguru y'ikiyaga.

src: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
tgt: Aho ni ho Abongereza bafashe ubutaka bw'icyo gihugu, bityo niba ushaka ibimenyetso by'uko icyo gihugu cyahozeho mu gihe cy'abakoloni, aha ni ho ugomba gutangira.

src: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
tgt: Sundarbans ni umujyi munini cyane ku isi, ukagera ku birometero 80 uvuye ku nkombe y'inyanja ukagera mu gihugu cya Bangladesh no mu Buhinde.

src: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
tgt: Igice cy'iyo misozi kiri ku butaka bw'u Buhinde cyitwa Pariki y'Igihugu ya Sundarbans.

src: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though - they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
tgt: Ayo mashyamba si amarozi y'ibiti byitwa mangrove gusa, ahubwo ni amwe mu mashyamba ya nyuma asigaye mu mashyamba y'igihangange yakundaga kuba mu kibaya cya Gange.

src: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km2, of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
tgt: Sundarbans ifite ubuso bwa kilometero kare 3,850, aho hafi kimwe cya gatatu cyubatswe n'amazi / ibigega .

src: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
tgt: Kuva mu mwaka wa 1966, uturere twa Sundarbans twabaye ahantu heza ho kurinda ibinyabuzima byo mu ishyamba, kandi bivugwa ko muri ako karere ubu hari ingwe z'i Bengal z'icyamamare zigera kuri 400, hamwe n'inuma zigera kuri 30.000.

src: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
tgt: Amatorero ava ku kibuga cy'imodoka cy'intara (ku rundi ruhande rw'uruzi) umunsi wose, nubwo menshi, cyane cyane ayo yerekeza mu burasirazuba na Jakar/Bumthang ava hagati ya 06:30 na 07:30.

src: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
tgt: Kubera ko za bisi zigenda mu turere dutandukanye akenshi ziba zuzuye, ni byiza kugura tikiti iminsi mike mbere y'igihe.

src: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
tgt: Amatorero menshi akoreshwa n'amabisi manini yo mu Buyapani akoreshwa n'abapilote, akaba meza kandi akomeye.

src: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
tgt: Imodoka zo gutwara abantu ni uburyo bworoshye kandi bwihuse bwo kujya mu turere turi hafi yaho, urugero nka Paro (Nu 150) na Punakha (Nu 200).

src: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
tgt: Uruzitiro rw'uruzi Oyapock ni uruzitiro rwubatswe n'ibishyimbo, ruhuza imijyi ya Oiapoque muri Brezili na Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock muri Guyane y'Abafaransa.

src: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
tgt: Inzu ebyiri zifite uburebure bwa metero 83, uburebure bwa metero 378 kandi zifite imihanda ibiri y'uburebure bwa metero 3.50.

src: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
tgt: Igishushanyo mbonera kiri munsi y'uru rugomero gifite metero 15. Igishushanyo mbonera cyarangiye mu kwezi k'Ugushyingo 2011, nticyari cyemerewe gutwara abantu kugeza muri Werurwe 2017.

src: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
tgt: Urwo ruzitiro ruteganyijwe gutangira gukora mu kwezi kwa Nzeri 2017, igihe ibigo by'imisoro bya Brezil biteganyijwe ko bizarangira.

src: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
tgt: Abaturage bo mu bwoko bw'Abaguarani ni bo bantu bakomeye cyane bo muri ako gace ubu kari mu burasirazuba bwa Paraguay, kandi babaga mu bwoko bw'abahunzi b'impunzi kandi bakoraga ubuhinzi.

src: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
tgt: Mu karere ka Chaco hari indi miryango y'abatuye muri ako karere, urugero nk'aba Guaycurú n'aba Payaguá, bakomezaga kubaho binyuriye mu gushakisha, gutunganya no kuroba.

src: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies," was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
tgt: Mu kinyejana cya 16, igihugu cya Paraguay, cyahoze cyitwa "Intara y'Amajyepfo y'Abanya-Afurika", cyavutse bitewe n'uko abasirikare b'Abasupanyoli bahanganye n'abatuye icyo gihugu.

src: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
tgt: Abanyespanye batangiye igihe cy'ubukoloni bwagumyeho ibinyejana bitatu.

src: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
tgt: Kuva Asunción yubatswe mu mwaka wa 1537, igihugu cya Paraguay cyabashije kubungabunga byinshi mu bintu by'ibanze by'umwimerere n'imiterere yacyo.

src: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
tgt: Igihugu cya Argentine kizwiho kuba gifite umwe mu matsinda n'abakinnyi b'umupira w'amaguru bakomeye ku isi.

src: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
tgt: Imikino nini cyane y'umwaka iba mu kwezi k'Ukuboza ku kibuga cy'umupira wa polo kiri i Las Canitas.

src: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
tgt: Mu bindi bihe by'umwaka, abantu bashobora no kureba imikino n'imikino ntoya.

src: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
tgt: Niba wifuza kumenya amakuru y'imikino n'aho ushobora kugura amatike y'imikino ya polo, reba Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

src: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
tgt: Ifaranga ryemewe n'amategeko ry'Ibihugu bya Falklands ni pound ya Falkland (FKP), agaciro kayo akaba ari nk'akayabo ka pound imwe y'u Bwongereza (GBP).

src: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
tgt: Amafaranga ashobora guhindurwa muri banki yonyine yo mu birwa iri i Stanley ihuye n'uruganda rwa FIC West .

src: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
tgt: Muri rusange, amafaranga y'Abongereza yemerwa ahantu hose mu birwa, kandi muri Stanley credit cards na dollars z'Amerika na zo zikunze kwemerwa.

src: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
tgt: Mu birwa byo mu majyepfo, ntibashobora kwemera gukoresha ikarita y'ikiguzi, nubwo bashobora gufata amafaranga yo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika n'ay'Ubwongereza; mujye mubaza mbere y'igihe ba nyirayo kugira ngo mumenye uburyo bwemewe bwo kwishyura.

src: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
tgt: Kuba amafaranga yo muri Falklands adashobora guhindurwa hanze y'ibyo birwa, ni yo mpamvu ugomba guhinduranya amafaranga mbere yo kuva mu birwa.

src: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
tgt: Kubera ko Montevideo iherereye mu majyepfo y'isi, iyo mu majyepfo habagaho igihe cy'impeshyi, naho mu majyaruguru habagaho igihe cy'imbeho.

src: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
tgt: Montevideo iri mu turere tw'ubushyuhe; mu mezi y'impeshyi, ibipimo by'ubushyuhe birenga 30°C ni ibisanzwe.

src: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'imbeho, haba hari ubushyuhe buke cyane, kuko ubushyuhe butari bwigere bujya munsi ya dogere imwe, ariko umuyaga n'ubushyuhe bigatuma umuntu yumva ko hari ubushyuhe bwinshi kurusha uko ibipimo byerekana.

src: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
tgt: Nta gihe cy' "imvura" n'icya "umwuzure" by'umwihariko, kuko umubare w'imvura uguma ari wo nyene mu mwaka wose.

src: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
tgt: N'ubwo inyamaswa nyinshi zo muri iyo pariki zikunda kubona abantu, ni inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba kandi ntizigomba kuribwa cyangwa guhangayikishwa na zo.

src: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
tgt: Dukurikije uko abayobozi b'iyo pariki babitangaza, jya uhunga kure n'imiburiburi ibirometero 100 uvuye ku ngurube n'impene, kandi ujye uhunga kure n'ibirometero 25 uvuye ku zindi nyamaswa zose zo mu ishyamba!

src: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
tgt: N'ubwo bisa n'ibikunda kumvira, ibikoko nk'ibisoni, ingwe, ingwe z'inkazi, inyenyeri, n'ibikoko hafi ya byose by'inkazi zikomeye, birashobora kuzirasa.

src: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
tgt: Buri mwaka, abashyitsi babarirwa mu bihumbi barakomereka bitewe n'uko badasize intera ikwiriye hagati yabo.

src: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
tgt: Byongeye kandi, ujye wibuka ko amavuta ashyushye atuma inzovu n'ibindi binyabuzima byo mu ishyamba bikwegera, bityo wirinde gutwara cyangwa guteka ibiryo bifite amavuta ashyushye kandi ugire ahantu heza aho uba.

src: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
tgt: Umujyi wa Apia ni umurwa mukuru wa Samoa, ukaba uri ku kirwa cya Upolu, ukaba ufite abaturage bari munsi ya 40.000.

src: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
tgt: Apia yubatswe mu myaka ya 1850 kandi ni umurwa mukuru wa Samoa kuva mu 1959.

src: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
tgt: Icyo cyambu ni ho mu mwaka wa 1889 habaye intambara y'ubwato, ubwo amato arindwi ava mu Budage, muri Amerika no mu Bwongereza yanze kuva muri icyo cyambu.

src: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
tgt: Amato yose yaguye mu mazi, keretse umwe w'Abongereza. Abamerika n'Abadage bagera hafi kuri 200 barapfuye.

src: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'intambara y'ubwigenge yateguwe n'itsinda rya Mau, inama yo mu mahoro mu mujyi yatumye umukuru mukuru Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III yicwa.

src: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
tgt: Kubera ko mu mujyi wa Auckland hari ibigega bibiri, hari ibirunga byinshi.

src: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
tgt: Ibiyaga bya North Shore (mu karere ka North Harbour) biri ku Nyanja ya Pasifika kandi biva i Long Bay mu majyaruguru kugera i Devonport mu majyepfo.

src: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
tgt: Hafi ya zose ni ibirunga by'umusenyi, aho umuntu ashobora koga mu buryo bw'umutekano, kandi hafi ya zose zifite igicu cy'ibiti bya pohutukawa.

src: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
tgt: Ibirunga bya Tamaki Drive biri ku kibuga cy'indege cya Waitemata, mu mijyi ya Mission Bay na St Heliers iri mu mujyi wa Auckland.

src: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
tgt: Ibi ni ibiyaga by'inyanja rimwe na rimwe usanga abantu benshi bahuriraho n'imiryango yabo, hakaba n'amaduka menshi ahagaze hafi y'inyanja.

src: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta."
tgt: Ibinyobwa by'iwacu ni 'Number One', ntabwo ari ibinyobwa byoroheje, ahubwo biryoha kandi biruhura.Ibindi biryo by'iwacu bitwa "Manta".

src: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
tgt: Hari inzoga nyinshi zo mu Bufaransa, ariko inzoga zo muri Nouvelle-Zélande n'izo muri Ositaraliya zishobora gukwirakwira kurushaho.

src: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
tgt: Amazi yo mu mifuka yo muri ako gace nta kibazo afite, ariko iyo ufite ubwoba, biroroshye kubona amazi yo mu macupa.

src: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
tgt: Ku bantu bo muri Ostraliya, igitekerezo cyo kunywa ikawa y'umweru ntaho gihuriye n'iby'amahanga.

src: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
tgt: Amavuta y'imbuto ni ay'igiciro cyinshi ariko ni ay'igikundiro.

src: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
tgt: Hari abantu benshi bajya muri uwo mugezi mu mwaka wose, kandi biragoye ko umuntu yakomereka bitewe n'imwe muri iyo mpamvu.

src: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
tgt: Nubwo bimeze bityo ariko, jya witabira inama z'abategetsi, wumvire ibimenyetso byose, kandi witondere cyane inama z'umutekano.

src: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
tgt: Mu majyaruguru y'u Burayi, ibi binyabutabire biboneka hafi y'inyanja no hafi y'amajyepfo y'inzuzi kuva mu kwezi k'Ukwakira kugeza muri Mata 1770.

src: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
tgt: Ariko kandi, ni gake cyane abantu bagerwaho n'izo nyamaswa, kuko nyinshi muri zo zitinya abantu.

src: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
tgt: Inyamanswa zo mu mazi y'umunyu ntizikora cyane mu nyanja, aho zikorera cyane ni mu mazi y'uruzi mu majyaruguru ya Rockhampton.

src: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
tgt: Iyo umuntu ateganya urugendo mbere y'igihe, aba afite amahoro yo mu mutima, kuko aba azi ko igihe azaba ageze aho agiye, azaba afite aho aryama.

src: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
tgt: Akenshi abacuruza ibijyanye n'urugendo bagirana amasezerano n'amahoteli runaka, nubwo ushobora kubona ko ushobora kugura ibindi byumba binyuze kuri bo, urugero nk'ahantu ho kurara.

src: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
tgt: Abacuruza ibicuruzwa by'urugendo akenshi batanga ibicuruzwa birimo n'ifunguro ry'umugoroba, gutwara abantu ku kibuga cy'indege cyangwa bakavaho, ndetse n'ibicuruzwa by'indege n'ibya hoteli.

src: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
tgt: Bashobora kandi kugufasha mu gihe ukeneye igihe cyo gutekereza ku byo bazakugenera cyangwa gushaka ibindi bimenyetso by'aho ugiye (urugero, viza).

src: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
tgt: Ibikoresho cyangwa ibisabwa byose bigomba gutangirwa n'abakozi b'uru rugendo aho gutangirwa n'aho hoteli iri.

src: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
tgt: Mu minsi mikuru imwe n'imwe, abenshi mu bantu bajya mu birori by'umuziki bahitamo gushyingura aho bibera, kandi abenshi muri bo babibona nk'ikintu cy'ingenzi cyane mu byo babonye.

src: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
tgt: Niba wifuza kuba hafi y'icyo gikorwa ugomba kwinjira hakiri kare kugira ngo ugere aho uherereye aho umuziki uri.

src: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
tgt: Wibuke ko nubwo umuziki ushobora kuba wararangiye ku bibuga by'imyidagaduro by'ingenzi, hari ibice by'uwo munsi mukuru bishobora gukomeza kuririmbwa kugeza nimugoroba.

src: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
tgt: Mu minsi mikuru imwe n'imwe, hari ahantu hashyizweho amatongo ahagenewe imiryango irimo abana bato.

src: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
tgt: Niba ujya mu majyaruguru y'inyanja ya Baltique mu gihe cy'imbeho, jya usuzuma aho ubwato buherereye, kubera ko iyo ujya mu gifu usanga habaho urusaku rukomeye cyane ku bantu bahuye na rwo cyane.

src: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
tgt: Abatuye St. Petersburg ntibategekwa visa (reba amategeko).

src: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
tgt: Muri rusange, ibigo by'imikino y'amahirwe bigira imihati myinshi kugira ngo byiteze ko abashyitsi bakoresha igihe kinini n'amafaranga menshi.

src: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
tgt: Akenshi batanga ibiryo, ibinyobwa n'imyidagaduro bidasanzwe, kugira ngo abashyitsi bakomeze kugira ibyishimo kandi bakomeze kuba mu nzu.

src: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
tgt: Ariko kandi, kunywa inzoga bituma umuntu adashobora gufata imyanzuro myiza, kandi abakinnyi bose b'inkoramutima bazi ko ari iby'ingenzi kutagira inzoga.

src: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
tgt: Umuntu wese ugiye gutwara imodoka mu misozi cyangwa mu misozi, yagombye gutekereza ku birebana n'ibihe by'urubura, icyatsi, cyangwa ubushyuhe bukomeye cyane.

src: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
tgt: Mu mihanda irimo icyatsi n'umusenyi, nta kintu na kimwe cyayihungabanya, kandi ntushobora gutwara imodoka nk'aho waba uri ku muhanda w'umusenyi utabaye.

src: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
tgt: Mu gihe cy'ibihuha by'umusenyi, igicu gishobora kugwa mu gihe gito cyane.

src: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
tgt: Kubona bishobora no kugabanuka bitewe n'imvura y'igicu cyangwa icyondo ku madirishya y'imodoka.

src: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
tgt: Ku rundi ruhande, mu bihugu byinshi, icyatsi n'umusenyi ni ibisanzwe, kandi muri rusange imodoka zitwara abantu n'ibintu ntizihagarara mu mwaka wose.

src: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
tgt: Birashoboka ko ingendo zo gusura Afurika ari zo zituma abashyitsi benshi bayikunda cyane, kandi ni na zo zituma abashyitsi benshi bayibona.

src: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
tgt: Ijambo "safari" ryakunze gukoreshwa ryerekeza ku bantu bagendera ku butaka kugira ngo barebe inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba z'Afurika, cyane cyane izo mu misozi.

src: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
tgt: Ibinyabuzima bimwe na bimwe, urugero nk'inzovu n'inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa girafe, usanga bikunda kwegera imodoka cyane, kandi ibikoresho bisanzwe bifasha abantu kubona neza imodoka.

src: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
tgt: Intare, inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bwa cheetah n'intare zo mu bwoko bwa leopard, rimwe na rimwe usanga zifite isoni, kandi ushobora kuzibonera neza ukoresheje icyuma gikora mu maso.

src: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk," "hiking safari," or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
tgt: Gukora urugendo rw'amaguru (rwitwa kandi "urugendo rwo mu mashyamba", "urugendo rw'amaguru", cyangwa "urugendo rw'ibirenge") ni urugendo rw'amaguru rw'amasaha make cyangwa iminsi myinshi.

src: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
tgt: Imikino ya Paralempike izatangira ku itariki ya 24 Kanama kugeza ku ya 5 Nzeri 2021.Hari imikino izabera mu bindi bice byo mu Buyapani.

src: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
tgt: Tokyo izaba ari yo mujyi rukumbi wo muri Aziya wakiriye imikino Olempike y'impeshyi inshuro ebyiri, nyuma yo kwakira imikino ya 1964.

src: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
tgt: Niba waraguriye indege n'ubwiherero mu mwaka wa 2020 mbere y'uko hatangazwa ko byahagaritswe, ushobora guhura n'ibibazo.

src: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
tgt: Amategeko yo guhagarika amarushanwa atandukanye, ariko kugeza mu mpera z'ukwezi kwa Werurwe, menshi mu mategeko yo guhagarika amarushanwa ashingiye kuri coronavirus ntiyakomeza kugeza muri Nyakanga 2020, igihe imikino ya Olimpike yari iteganyijwe.

src: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
tgt: Biteganyijwe ko amakarita menshi y'igitaramo azagura hagati ya ¥2,500 na ¥130,000, mu gihe amakarita asanzwe agura hafi ¥7,000.

src: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
tgt: Imodoka nyinshi zifite ibyuma n'ibiro byo kubikoresha, ushobora kubikodesha, n'iyo nta muntu uri mu cyumba.

src: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
tgt: Niba udashobora kubona icyuma cy'umusatsi, cyangwa niba udashaka kwambara amakote y'umusatsi, ushobora kugerageza gukoresha umutobe w'umusatsi, niba ufite.

src: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
